description:
An old San Francisco institution that serves good cocktails and drinks. It's a classic bar with good ambience and friendly service. They also have a huge wine cellar with a decent selection of wine, the last thing you would expect in a bar like this :-) 

It's open late and the bar is nothing super special on the inside. It's just a classic American bar with a huge selection of spirits and a fairly extensive cocktail menu. The patrons seem like regulars and the ladies serving here seem like they have also been here for ages. The owner is also around from time to time and chatting with guests. 

I liked it enough to come back here three times during my week stay here. It's reasonably priced for this town and the cocktails I had were good.
author: Sam S.

description:
This was a nice impromptu bar! Went here after leaving the house of ice cream and loved it. I'm visiting from San Diego and have never been to a bar where they give you popcorn and peanuts. That was a nice touch! 

I ordered the cable car cosmo. It was delicious. I had two and I'll probably be back if I ever come to San Fran again!
author: Michelle F.

description:
On my last day in San Francisco I was planning to do a little shopping downtown and ya know, all that walking and shopping makes you thirsty. Sam's Cable Car Lounge was really the only bar that opened early-ish on a Sunday (11:30) so I stopped in for a beer. The location is great, right on the path of the cable cars going to and from the turnaround. The bar itself was super hip with a variety of cocktails available and a cigar shop in the corner. I ordered a Peroni and was served a small bowl of peanuts to snack on. It certainly wasn't the cheapest beer I had in San Francisco but the view was nice and the beer was refreshing. Their bathroom area is cute, the ceilings were very low it made me feel like I was walking into a fun house. Looks like they have a downstairs wine cellar too. I could definitely see myself hanging out here again if I'm in town. 

Tip: If you're looking to ride the cable cars get a ticket from the separate booth and be prepared to stand in line on a Sunday. I think I was looking at an hour wait and decided to walk instead. I would have jumped on some of the further stops but the cable car was moving so much slower than I could walk (even uphill) that it wasn't worth it.
author: Emily B.

description:
I think the prices of the beer is too excessive 9 dollars for a beer its too expensive and they also charge you 20 % of the tips automatically! That's ridiculous 
Never come back!!
author: Manases C.

description:
Decided to stop in here for some drinks, as it's one of the only bars in the area around Union Square and our hotel.

We ordered 2 beers, nothing super fancy.  They did give us a bag of popcorn.  The bill came, and my jaw dropped, $28 for 2 beers.  Damn!  That's way too rich for my blood.

Seems like a pretty cool spot to chill, has a good vibe, but I probably won't be back, as I can't afford that much for 2 beers.
author: Michelle H.

description: Looked and felt like a tourist trap, so it wasn't very comfortable. The atmosphere is slightly as if you're drinking in an amusement park. The bartenders were sort of odd and drinks were expensive (a little Titos and water for $11). Complimentary popcorn and nuts is a nice touch but adds to the carnival feel.
author: Rhianna M.

description:
I am amazed that this bar only has two $$. It's a very touristy bar in the middle of SF near union square. And it's insanely expensive. Like I've lived in SF for 3 years and this is the most expensive bar I've been to and I didn't expect it for a second. And it's not a 5 star hotel or a cocktail lounge. It's just a tourist bar. I got a glass - not even a pint- of peroni beer and it was 13.99. No joke! They add a service charge to the drinks which isn't clear and still leave space on the receipt for a tip. I thought it was a mistake but no- it was that expensive. I asked the bar tender was it a mistake and they said no- this place is just that expensive. The menu price was 875 for just a bud light and that was before he service charge too. 

I've written a paragraph about how expensive this place is so I'll move onto other things. The atmosphere is fairly good and the staff are friendly. It does feel like you're a on holidays here which is nice. But come on please- don't rip people off just because of the location!
author: Derek M.

description: Stopped by for a quick look one hot Sunday. Joint has been here for few years but never noticed this spot on Powell Street. And I walk by pretty frequently. It is very spacious bar with loads of tables and several good size TVs to watch games. Cool cable cars decor. Lots of funny old school posters by the bathroom in the back. Bartenders said they have a huge cellar in the basement. Nice spot with friendly bartenders and prices are decent.
author: Vee V.

description: the people here are nice, the beer was cold, however hold on to your hat, a bottle of domestic "Miller" was like $7 and there was an extra charge, because of the cost of living wage law in this city....  It was just too damn expensive, and I wished they would have told me this when I sat down
author: Paul G.

description:
Adventurous day in the city, had been recommended to two different places to grab a drink and food while we were here.. however after walking 40+ minutes, both locations were closed. Wanting a Bloody Mary we stubbled into Sam's Cable Car Lounge. Sam himself was quick to say hello, welcome us in, but not before checking all of our IDs. 

MAJOR STAPLE: popcorn, peanuts, and cheese
If you enjoy any of those along side your favorite alcoholic beverage this is the place for you (for free.)

For me, a place with no kids is the way to go, and although they aren't allowed here. Sam did not turn down the hospitality to anyone. Offered popcorn and peanuts to the family's who tried to come in but were not of age.

10/10 would recommend
author: Alana W.

description: This was a fun bar. A few beers on tap and a full selection of pretty much anything else. They also sold cigars at the front. (Not sure if you can smoke them inside or not so be aware if smoke bothers you) really cool environment and people.
author: Dj K.

description:
Sam's is a fun spot to stop for a drink. We normally stop in on a weekend afternoon after walking around Union Square. Not too many options to get a drink around there, so this was where we ended up. Nothing special, but just a good vibe and the bartenders are normally friendly. The prices are a bit high... $10+ for a ok-ish beer, but I guess it's because it's in Union Square.

They also give you free popcorn when you order a drink!
author: Derrick S.

description: This is an awesome little bar. We come up a couple times a year from Southern California and discovered it on this trip. First thing when we sat down we were served some popcorn and peanuts. Fabulous! Lots of TVs. Really really great music! The staff here is very very friendly and willing to help. We will definitely be back! Give it a try! Love it!
author: Robin E.

description:
I randomly bumped into an old friend on the street after work. Wanting to grab a drink together, we wandered around downtown only to find every place packed. We eventually settled on Sam's Cable Car Lounge as another friend suggested it. We arrived on Thursday, February 16th around 6:30pm. It wasn't packed at all, so we easily grabbed two seats at the bar. The friend that suggested this place joined us a little later and was able to grab a seat next to us.

*Bulleit Bourbon on the rocks ($9.75)
*Old Fashioned ($8.75) x2, one with Bulleit Rye (+$2), one with Maker's Mark (+$2)
*Cable Car Nachos: tortilla chips, cheddar cheese sauce and sliced jalapenos ($9.95)

I got the Bulleit Bourbon on the rocks, though I do believe I asked for Rye. Not a big deal in the end. I just wanted something to sip on. I didn't taste the Old Fashioneds, but everyone seemed to enjoy their cocktails. The nachos were on the larger size, but for just chips, cheese and jalapenos, I thought they were pricey at almost $10. They do give you complimentary popcorn and peanuts though.

Sam's has a happy hour Monday through Friday, 2pm to 6pm. Draft beers and Well drinks are $6.50 while House wines are $7.50. Not the best HH pricing in general, but considering their beers are $8.25-$10.75, it is still a decent discount. Overall, due to the location, I felt this place was kind of a tourist trap. And pricey. Cocktails averaged $14-$15.

I got to check another place off my list of bookmarks, but I wasn't really impressed with their drinks and food. One saving grace, I did see a case of cigars on the way out. I do love smoking a cigar while drinking some scotch or whiskey. There is a chance I might be back for that.
author: Elena N.

description:
Sam's is a nice place and well maintained, great location in downtown SF and the staff are super friendly. So why only 3 stars? 

Well I ordered a beer (Guinness from a can) and a shot of Jameson and had a $20 in my hand ready to pay. When my check arrived I realized that my $20 wouldn't cover it, as the bill ended until being $25. For a beer from a can and a shot. Too rich for my blood. Won't be back.
author: Kalen F.

description: Simple, approachable, effective, lively and fun. Local bar meets tourist location done right. I also really appreciate the super effective seating. You don't have to awkwardly fish around for a spot, the hostess will tell you: "I have a spot on the bar" saving you from the walk of frustration if there is none. You can always come back later, this is a seriously busy location.
author: Sampo K.

description:
YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2017: 5/100.

FIRST OF FIVE SPOTS FOR NYE! 

Hubbers and I got off the Bart and looked around. We agreed to stop at the first bar we see. 

Sam's Cable Car Lounge it is. 

Ordered a Blue Moon. 

Hubbers got Captain Morgan. 

Boy, was our bartender FAST. 

We took a better look at the menu for possible appetizers. We immediately decided against it when we saw "22% service charge will be added" at the bottom of the menu. 

I'd understand better if we were a party of 6 or more, but 22% across the board IMMEDIATELY?! 

Granted the service we got was good, what if it happened to tank?!

BUT WAIT!!! The receipt DOES say, "If unsatisfied, you may ask to remove service charge." 

I wonder how often people actually read this BEFORE they pay. Many Yelpers have commented they added tip without knowing they've already been charged for it. 

I also noticed many Yelpers (with not-so-stellar reviews) giving negative remarks on the automatic 22% service charge. 

(I'm with them. Although I have the option of having it removed, I simply don't like being told how much to tip off the bat.) 

It's a good maneuver, really. 

Anyway, we finished our drinks, paid the bill and learned a bit too late that they were giving away popcorn and peanuts for free. 

I wish we were told this soon as we sat down. 

Hubbers and I decided to bounce to Bartlett Hall - where we ordered comparable drinks AND an appetizer for only a $1 more than the total tab here. (That's including tipping generously.) Nope. No mandated 22% service charge implemented there.

We were okay with stopping by. I highly doubt we'd come back, though.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Good selection of beer / drink. Relaxed and good service. 
Friendly staff, lots of sports on, good place for the first drink of the night.
author: Robert R.

description:
Really neat decor .. should be good to catch a game live.. good music when nothing important is on TV.. 
Not sure about the food though.. ordered the wings.. can't get that wrong.. right? This however, stank like fish. Lost my appetite..
author: Joseph A.

description: If you're near union square and you're looking for a chill cocktail bar with decent music, I would definitely recommend this place. It's pretty casual, and they give complimentary snacks. They have food as well as cocktails. The cocktails are actually very good, and the service is good as well
author: Marigny L.

description:
Limited tap selection but relatively good choices. Excellent liquor collection.  Campy atmosphere. Good music. Personable bartenders. 

5 large screen TVs detract from an otherwise quality experience.
author: J H.

description: When they give you a bill,is actually already included services charge 20%.but in another bill for you sign,they put blank spot for tipping again.this is happen to me when i took my friends there.and i did doule times tips because they sneaky to trapped you.
author: Peter J.

description: This place is in the middle of one of the most touristy spots in the city but we've found ourselves here grabbing a couple of weekend day-drinks on more than one occasion. It's fine for a quick beer or two.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Had a great time.  Stopped in to grab a quick beer and ended up staying for a beer and two glasses of wine.  Service was personable, attentive and endearing.  They have free peanuts, popcorn, and cheese if you order wine. 

It's a bit of a hole in the wall.  Its a like a dive bar but without the old nasty beer smell.
author: Candace R.

description:
I should've known from the moment I entered this place that I shouldn't have entered it. The garish hostess woman with the red lipstick should've been warning enough. When she brought me complimentary popcorn I almost thought she was going to give me a lap dance, too. But I digress. Here's the real reason not to go here:
It's math. I ordered a gin martini for $11.75. They added a $3 surcharge cuz it was a martini! (Didn't say that in menu!) Then they added $2.95 service charge. Then they added $1.50 tax! (Sales tax, if they can even add it should've been only $.99. This one martini cost me $19.20.!!. Don't go here. Rip off. Tourists beware!!
author: jeff s.

description: Stopping in for a quickie.  Crew is nice and helpful, even though we got the wrong beer served to us.  They fixed it with a smile.  Clean and friendly.
author: MImi M.

description: Tourist trap. Pricey. Staff was friendly though. Menu was expansive. Space seemed older but was well maintained. My least favorite stop in SF.
author: Dirt F.

description: Look on yelp for a quick stop to just enjoy a drink. Had good reviews so we stopped in and was very pleased with the place. Very friendly staff and great vibe.
author: Tammy J.

description:
Unbelievable rip off. Sit down and handed a menu that says $7.50 for a glass of house Cabernet. It's actually $12.50 a glass!! Go to pay the bill and it's $31!!!!  20% service charge added. Wtf!!??? I have to imagine they have been looked into by the better businesses bureau. 
They try to explain that they only have one Cabernet and it's a good deal. They all walk away when I say they have to be ashamed of themselves. I assume they get this everyday. 
Never ever go to this dump!!!! 

Worst bar in San Francisco. They should be ashamed.
author: Mike R.

description: What a joke of a bar. Filled with asshole, the service not the patrons. Avoid this place at all costs.
author: Jared N.

description: After nearly being shot on a dark street in the neighborhood by union square, a friend and I saw the beacon of this bar's "cocktails" neon and decided to drink away the memory. They're friendly, give you peanuts and popcorn (cheerfully called "snackies" by the mom-like proprietor), and you can peacefully forget your near life-threatening situations. $6.75 for well drinks. 10/10 would survive to come here again.
author: Maggie M.

description:
well well well.... isn't good bar a wonderful find !!!!
Always have a great time here. Amazing drinks and very attentive customer service and specially "ELIZABETH" adds star to this place .I will definitely keep coming !!!!!!
author: Jyotsna P.

description: Place seems OK save for an unadvertised service charge. One drink + $3 mandatory service charge = poor review and no drink #2.
author: Landon B.

description: Great place mixed with locals and tourists.  Extremely friendly staff and the drinks are well made.  Will become a local staple for me in the future.
author: John H.

description:
Had a great time here. Good service and great drinks. They were very attentive and friendly... even 
more so after I got hit in the head with a random side door on the way to the bathroom!
author: Michelle S.

description:
This place is for suckers. Or tourists. There is absolutely nothing San Francisco about it. It's gimmicky and tacky, and with some of the most overpriced drinks even for the Union Square area. Don't even think about coming here outside the Happy Hour times, and even the HH is barely worth a buck. Asian ownership did train the bartenders to be polite and attentive, but that's about the only good thing about this place. And not even all of the bartenders are polite - the hostess that checks your IDs isn't exactly nice to you. 
All in all, this place feels divey but without any character, yet it's priced as an unscale lounge which it isn't. Not recommended.
author: Evg R.

description: This place is garbage. Overpaid and the atmosphere is wack.this is what's wrong with SF.
author: Pedro C.

description:
I went to this place on Sep 10 with couple friends visiting from China. We were having good time there, which was why I gave additional tips after I was charged 22% on my bill. The subtotal was $87.03 (including 22% tips they charged). Then I tip $12.97 additionally to make it a total $100.00 bill. However, it showed that my bill was $100.03 totally when I checked my banking account couple days later. 

I don't care about giving 3 cents more since I already tip them extra, but I just guess they were not supposed to do so. I don't care about how much I spend there at least we had a good time there, but what they did on the bill just made me feel sick!
author: Lei S.

description: Way worst tourist trap rip off of a place  ever...went two times today, my first and last!
author: Keith Y.

description:
I had a really good time here twice!  Yes, I made a return trip to Sam's Cable Car I liked it so much.  The staff is great and pays close attention to their customers.  I stopped in for happy hour both times.  They have some great deals on wine and beer during happy hour.  They serve up some free snacks too.

I really enjoy the Sir Fox wine they serve.  It's light, crisp, and has great flavor.  I liked it so much I bought a few bottles.  Once they are gone, I'll go back for more.  I'm not much of a wine drinker but that brand I enjoy.  

Keep up the good work guys!
author: Brian K.

description: I arrived here for drinks only with a few friends. The greeter at the door was friendly and entertaining. It was moderately busy when we arrived, but didn't seem to slow down the bartenders much. We had a few beers and some mixed drinks. The Pina Colada was awesome! Not very strong and delicious. The bar offered complementary peanuts and popcorn with the drinks which I had never experienced in a bar before. I thought it was an excellent gesture and ate two bags. The decor here was enjoyable and didn't feel to cramped. Overall I would go back!
author: Christopher C.

description: Friendly servers and good drinks. Of course you will pay the price because you are in the touristy area.  Appetizers definitely need to be improved. We ordered chips and salsa , no lie -Tostito chips and Pace Picante sauce out of a jar at almost $7!!  That's why I give them 4 stars. A huge thank you though to the staff who noticed we forgot our ATM card and kept it for us until we could return to get it. We will definitely be back for drinks only.
author: Justina V.

description: Overpriced with everything. Just get a beer if you really need to go. Got the nachos for $16 and only had had chips, barely any nacho cheese and jalapeños...the saddest nachos I've ever seen.
author: Byrrnye W.

description:
Cool little dive bar that we happened to come across when we were in SF for the day (from Sac) and wanted to watch some of the Giants/Cubs game. We sat at the bar and asked the bartender if they had sangria (our fav drink). He said no they didn't but he could make us one and we could taste it. If we didn't like it, he would take it back. He made one for us and I had him add some simple syrup to it and it was perfect!

They also offered popcorn and nuts to snack on while we sat and watched the game. This place was very cool and the people were super nice. We will definitely be back here!
author: Lysa D.

description: A bit pricey but your in union square so you have to know what your getting into. I like that they give you peanuts and popcorn when you order a drink. I didn't try the food. But the beer is cold.
author: Mike P.

description: This place was ok on ambiance, but when we got the bill and there was a mandatory 20% included service fee... we were floored. Seriously??? So our $13.95 regular martini and $9.75 half pint of beer became a mandatory $5.00 per round tip!! We had 3 rounds without knowing this was being tallied. This place SUCKS because they do this, and the server who was generally kind, especially when I called them out on the included obnoxious service fee, said they only get 8% so the other 12% goes to the house.  What the hell? Just because you don't like tourists who don't tip, doesn't mean you can rape your other normal tipping customers. We will never return!!
author: Sc G.

description:
I LOVE this place! 

I was coming into The City two days ago from the East Bay and took BART for the first time (that was an experience!). I was headed up to Union Square to meet an out-of-town friend for lunch. As I walked up Powell St., I saw this place and was intrigued. So much so that I stopped, walked back to the front of the building, and poked my head in. Cool place -- I need to try it out sometime. 

As my friend and I were talking at lunch, she mentioned that somewhere around this area is a bar that her husband really enjoys frequenting when he is in San Francisco for work. She had been with him before and said it's a really neat place and then she told me the name. I was so shocked that in a city so large, she said the ONE bar/lounge name that I knew, and had only JUST learned. I told her it was right around the corner, and after lunch, we went there. 

The male and female bartenders (I didn't get names...yikes!) were both VERY welcoming and friendly. We ordered our drinks and when they arrived in a very timely manner, the bartender realized she had made me the wrong drink, and I was welcome to keep that one at no charge. Score! She made the correct drink while the gentleman got us popcorn, peanuts, and cheese. How nice!

We had a great time talking to the bartenders...mostly the guy...and he was really funny, but in a genuine way. 

As far as the 22% gratuity goes, I do agree that it's a little steep, but you get what you are charged for. They completely catered to us and made us feel like we were the only two in there. They were very quick and efficient, and we did get all the little bar snacks. I can't say they didn't earn that money, because they did. And it says on your bill/check//receipt that you may ask to have the automatic gratuity charge removed, so no one should have an issue with it. 

I highly recommend this place to everyone.
author: Greg C.

description: Love this place. Elizabeth and all the staff is great except for this weird guy in the background never doing anything the entire time we were here. I would give this place five stars except he's here. What's up with that. Maybe he is related to the owner and feels like he doesn't have to do anything!  Other than that it's a super great place to hang out at !  Thx ladies for the good time.
author: Flo F.

description: Hella over priced. Extremely limited food menu. Tourist trap. There's tv to watch a game but not much else to look at.
author: Natasha K.

description: I came to grab a beer before I head out of the city. The service was fine. The bottled beer was good, I check out and I get charged a mandatory fee. My single beer ended up being almost $15. What a rip off... I was just telling my gf how I wanted her to come with me next time and after this I won't even return to this place. The bar tender couldn't even look me in the eye after he saw me look at the bill.
author: Mike C.

description:
Why didn't I check reviews before I went in ??? Argggggg
They pull you in with $6 drink prices then add hidden fee's .. So very wrong .. 
At least if you're going to add these exorbitant extra fee's, staff should be nicer .. Didn't happen ..
author: Mary K.

description: Good drinks. Pricey though.  Great location nice staff.  But watch out don't tip on the check.  The tip is already on the check at 20%
author: Natalie M.

description: I thought this would be like a neighborhood bar. NOPE. It's a rip off. Total bill for 2 draft Anchor Steams was $22.79, not even pints.  Included in this was a $3.50 service charge. I came here hoping to avoid high costs of hotel bar but think that would have been cheaper. Staff was pleasant but just can't get over the $11 beers.
author: Bryan K.

description:
DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY....I'm sorry but when a place decides to upcharge their drink prices AND DECIDE TO TIP FOR YOU 22% on any beverage to cover THEIR costs?! NOPE NOT MY PROBLEM TO PAY A REASONABLE WAGE TO YOUR EMPLOYEES....$20 for two bud light bottles?!? Absolutely ridiculous 
Decor is outdated old music is crap staff is rude don't even greet you at the bar as you sit down, yet they feel they can charge so excessively and tip 22% with my money, nope this place is a dump and soooooo NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!!!!
author: Kamila N.

description:
Beware: this place is the epitome of the term "tourist trap", and a complete rip off.
My friend ordered a blue moon beer on tap, and was charged $10.50 for it. He tipped on top of that.  Later, I found out that they add a 22% service charge on each drink, but they don't inform customers that this 22% Tip is already added to the price of their drink. So my friend ended up tipping double.  I ordered a well vodka drink. It ended up being $9 after tax and the service charge. It was very weak. Since the bar is located only one half block away from Union Square, I am not surprised of the inflated prices. But I feel that charging a 22% service charge, and not letting people know about it is highly deceptive and unethical. I will not go back to this bar again.
author: Suzanne E.

description:
I've lived in the Bay Area for 20 years, so I'm used to high prices in San Francisco.  I know we are the most expensive city in the US.  But when I stopped in this bar for the first time yesterday afternoon and ordered a Blue Moon (domestic beer), I was shocked when the bartender said "That will be $10.29."

Now this place isn't the Top of the Mark nor the Palace Hotel.  It's a quaint little bar with a few TV's; a nice place to drink I'm sure, but nothing that warrants that price.  I asked the bartender about it, because I thought it must be a mistake, but she assured me that was the price and after all, "this is San Francisco."  Well yes, this is near Union Square, and they probably get lots of tourists who they like to overcharge, so I paid $13 in cash, (I included a tip, because the price wasn't the bartender's fault, right?) and enjoyed my beer.  

I didn't get really upset until . . . 

My friend order a drink and paid by credit card.  When they brought her the check it included a 22% service charge.  No really, you read that correctly.  They automatically included a 22% tip without her permission.  

Now let's forget the fact that including a tip is immoral and probably illegal.  If your service people aren't making enough in tips there's a problem, and if you want to compensate them start paying them more.

And let's forget the fact that it's 22%, which is a few points higher than the 20% that is typical for bars.

Let's go straight to the fact that when they charged me $10.29 for the beer, the bartender never told me service was included, not even when I mentioned how high the charge was, even after I tipped her another $2.71 which now it turns out equates to almost 30%.

I suspect this is illegal.  It's certainly immoral.  So yes Sam's Cable Car, you have not only lost my business, but earned a nice warning to tourists and locals.  Avoid this place.  There are plenty of places in the area to enjoy a nice drink with fair and transparent prices.
author: Glenn M.

description:
Holy hell, what gives? 

Who ever is in charge of pricing their cocktails is a crack smoking socialist Nazi. A crack smoking socialist Nazi that obviously doesn't care about return business. 

Case in point:

Me: Can I please have a double Chopin over, with a twist? 

Them: Sure!  But there will be a second twist! You'll have to twist your mind around the tab when we give it to you! 

Never in my LIFE have I paid $36.53 for a small glass of vodka. Mind you, this is my standard drink of choice, and I've been to a fair share of bars that will gouge for a premium drink, but never, NEVER to this extent. 

I kindly informed the bartender that this was the most I have EVER paid for this type of drink, and she apologized, and told me she hears that from people on a daily basis. 

WTF???????????? 

I urge you all not to support this establishment. They are clearly out to bilk the casual tourist and passerby, not to run an honest local watering hole.

Shame on you Sam's Cable Car Lounge. Shame, shame, shame.

EDIT: They charge an AUTOMATIC 18% gratuity, and then have an additional tip bracket on the bill.

The manager agreed to remove the 18% charge. Thanks, I guess.

FYI: the same drink at Lefty O'Douls $12.25...  TOTAL!  So much for the "exclusive real estate justifies the price"  argument......
author: Steve G.

description: My wife and I came here over the course of several nights as we were staying nearby. An expensive Asian-ran place with a sports theme, it was initially quite pleasant. Unfortunately it soon became apparent that the Maitre D appeared drunk and volatile, making jokes about kicking people out... The final straw was when I popped in at lunch time for a quick drink and, despite being almost empty, the bossy old woman who was cleaning up insisted that I do not wait in line for the bathroom and then began banging on the door (to the shock of the other customer) as if to prove someone was inside. I know it was occupied hence my waiting outside - a practise that is entirely normal. I decided to go elsewhere and found a lovely Irish pub that wouldn't be out of place in the UK only two minutes away.
author: Benjamin B.

description: In town from New York City. This place is sweaty and overpriced. The food was below average. Service was speedy and bartenders were cool. Atmosphere and decorations are sweet as well. Overall, I'm sweaty and unsatisfied with mozzarella sticks + meatball sub. Couldn't finish either of them. Place has a TON of potential though,
author: Zachary S.

description: Great atmosphere and servers. Tuni and Pha are the best. Great cocktails (Pha really knows her stuff) and Tuni is full of personality. We enjoyed drinks, shots and snacks while spending a few hours there. Gonna go back when in San Fran. My son lives there and is a regular. Staff really makes the place happen.
author: Gary M.

description: This is a great bar with great service. The drinks are awesome. The service staff is on point. I would definitely recommend the pizza. We had a few beers a few cocktails and a pepperoni pizza and it was awesome. I will definitely be back. Thank you Sam's.
author: Suhad I.

description:
Nice friendly little bar with fantastic service. Quaint and clean. Great place for break just off Union Square.

But I  left after leaving  $6 for the advertised  $5.50 happy hour draft  and a little ol lady came running after me saying I owed $8. I said the sign said $5.50 but she said tax brings it to $8. I gave her a buck and kept walking. Won't be back.
author: Harry W.

description:
I ordered a pint of Lagunitas IPA and paid $10.29 with tax and service charge. $1.71 was added as the tip for *one* beer. 

Tip aside that's more expensive than even destination hotels a block away in Union Square. I've never seen anything higher than $7 for a pint of this beer in the entire city. Further, I've never seen the tip automatically added to a party of one ever in my life. 

Service was fine but didn't include the $1.71 handjob one would expect for the price. 

Never again. I feel like a sucker.
author: Trev C.

description:
The drinks here are so good. We didn't know what we wanted to drink, so the bartender made us fireballs with ginger ale. It was...okay. Met some pretty awesome people at the bar as well. 
This is a great place to pregame!
author: Stephanie H.

description: My fiancé and I always enjoy coming here. I imagine many customers are out of town given the location, but we love the vibe. Good music, hospitable hosts (Elizabeth is very sweet!), TVs and free snacks to boot (popcorn, cheese, and peanuts!) with lots of refills.
author: Zinia G.

description:
My friend and I only stayed for like 2 minutes. It was a boring,  tiny little bar. There was no music playing because they'd rather watch the football game that was on.  Even the waitress said "it's just a boring bar" and she was right. 

Also,  this is a place for a much older crowd. We're in our 20's and the people there were 40+... wouldn't visit again.
author: Marci B.

description:
Elizabeth!!! WOW

I SINCERELY means this talk about customer service she truly give the best! As a GM I would definitely recruit her but I won't because if she's not here then I probably wouldn't come back.

I always stop here when I get of the Bart train and have a drink! Always a must when I come to the city. And I brought first timers! They had a blast!!!

Mad love to the team and owners here!! Always a good times
author: Veronica A.

description: On Saturday, 03/24/2018, I stopped by Sam's Cable Car Lounge for a drink.  The service was fine.  I had one cocktail.  What turned me off about this place is that you are automatically charged a 20% tip on your bill.  I am all four providing a tip, even if I received a somewhat OK service.  However, I don't think it is right when it is shoved down my throat.  Tips should be left up to the customer, if they wish to tip, and how much.  I will never return to this establishment again.
author: Ed E.

description: Elizabeth is AMAZING!!!! This has to be your go to for a quick drink while you're shopping, or just to hang out with friends. Right by union square, a respectful crowd with kind bartenders. My new go to location.
author: Ari V.

description:
Sure the popcorn, nuts, and cheese are nice but don't be fooled by the Yelp check-in special. It only applies to happy hours I am told. San Francisco seems to have spotty overpriced but mediocre restaurants and bars that overcharge because of tourism. This place is one of those places. The house Pinot is no better than what I can get back home for $4 a bottle. On the up side - the location is super convenient.

Suggestion - swing around the corner to Jasper's for better prices and more interesting food options.
author: MJ R.

description: Great vibe and music playing.  6 big screens to watch the game. Tasty drinks make this a must stop. I don't smoke but if you need a cigar stop by here too. Even let me bring in service dog no questions. In the heart of SF, average drink prices it is what it is and yes it's a bit  higher than average because of this, but when I come to SF makes this a good spot to stop regardless.
author: Jesse H.

description: Charlie and his staff are outstanding. Roxanne is very friendly and attentive and this place makes you feel at home. When you're in Union Square, you absolutely have to stop through for a drink. Tell them Larry sent you!
author: Larry W.

description:
To the entire staff at Sams Cable Car Lounge and especially Elizabeth,

Thank you for the warm welcoming at the start, the complimentary snacks that made my night (popcorn is my fav) & the great tasting drinks! Service sets a standard here, if you like a relaxed, at home feel, come to this establishment because they will deliver!! My first time in and I felt as if I had been coming here for years! Thanks again :)
author: Lolo S.

description:
Be extremely wary of these ratings. Either there's some kind of secret double entrance and we picked the wrong one, or people have very different bar standards than I do. 
Friends were visiting from out of town, so we wanted to hit up a touristy spot near union square to round out the night. We knew full well that this isn't a bar my bf and I would usually come to, given location/outside appearance etc. 
A lot of these reviews fail to mention the 22% service charge on all drinks. Added onto drinks that are already SF-priced (around $11 average) and excluding a gratuity, that is ridiculous.
 We sat down and were looking at the menu, only to be talked to not once, not twice, but THREE Times as we were told that if we weren't going to order anything, we would have to leave. A nearly empty bar at midnight on a Saturday, and you're kicking people out before they have a chance to scan the entire menu?! No thanks.
author: Delaynie K.

description:
I stopped by for a drink after hopping off the cable car at the end of the line. I Will not return. 7.75 for a blue moon and a automatic service charge for 22%. 

In addition the owner questioned me about if I was sure I was a customer when going to the restroom and making me point out my seat at the bar as she guarded the door.
author: Robert N.

description:
Wonderful place, cozy great music and very friendly service! ELIZABETH greeted us at the door and got us seated right away! The made sure to come around every now and then to make sure we got everything we needed.
Being a bar in a high traffic location I expected it to be very busy and nonpersonal but the friendly and welcoming staff caught me off guard.
Definitely going to make this a go to location every time I'm in the area!
author: david y.

description: I came here by myself on a business trip. Sat down at the main bar, met a cool local. I believe it was a Friday night, the lady I was talking to told me about there famous meatball sandwich. This lady makes these homemade meatball sandwiches and drops them off at this place. It was absolutely delicious, highly recommend if you want a filling and tasteful sandwich. Bartender was cool, nice selection of alcohol and fun atmosphere to hangout at.
author: David B.

description: Elizabeth does it again ! How does a waitress remember the details of your life after 4 months of not visiting ! I love her ! She remembered my beer my wine of choice ! and she is running around this place like an energizer bunny ! You have to come here after work . In just 45 mins I feel appreciate and loved ! So week is over time to enjoy !
author: S R.

description: The drinks are great by Tu the bartender, atmosphere is amazing. Before you leave, see Elizabeth at the cigar desk to get an amazing cigar.
author: Jake T.

description:
We went here as I recognized the name from researching where to go on Yelp before our trip.  It's alright...very dark inside, and the staff is kind of awkward.  The bartender was not chatty, but the bar-back was, but somewhat negative.  

We had a California Mule and a Golden Gate Gimlet.  Each $15.  They had the SF Mandate as everyone does on the bil here, but they also include a Service Charge (tip) so beware, and don't tip on top of that if you don't feel it's deserved.  We had one drink and left.  They give you a bag of popcorn and a dish of bar nuts.
author: Heidi I.

description: A San Francisco MUST!!!!! Elizabeth is incredible, the face of the franchise!!!! Great food and drinks, fun atmosphere!!!!
author: Steve W.

description: Automatic service charge.. and they don't even forewarn you as your writing in the tip. Mediocre drinks and service. Place has nice decor. I'll never return or recommend friends to go to this establishment. I'd give it 0 stars if I could.
author: Jenny L.

description: This place is great in the heart of downtown, great drinks, food and the staff is amazing.  Check out the wine celler for some really good wine and one of the largest bottles of SilverOak i have ever encountered.
author: Slim P.

description: Actually this place is a bar but I ordered a Ham dinner for supper, it was really delicious and outstanding. Not exactly inexpensive but I think the size can be shared for 2 people. Nice ambiance too.
author: Suria N.

description: If you go here keep on mind that you will not be able to pay your bills because it will cost you a fortune.
author: Robert D.

description: Honestly the sweetest Ambassador  Elizabeth has the memory of a dolphin which studies show is even better than an elephant she remembers everything.. A busy place but you never feel left out ! She's awesome
author: Colleen M.

description: Came here this bar on Saturday night.  I ordered a glass of raspberry mojito. Tastes and smell were wonderful. Can't believe it with a check in we got a free glass of wine. Superb service!! We'll def be coming back! Love you guys.
author: Yokiiez T.

description: All I can say is 2 PM to 6 PM happy hour. We have to be walking by and decided to pop in for a beer. Both the bartender and a cocktail waitress set down small bags of popcorn in front of us. Nice touch. Good vibe and good service.
author: Uncle S.

description: This bar pretends to be a 'hole-in-the-wall' locals type of place. It isn't. While the decor is nice and the staff is friendly, this is an over-priced tourist trap.  The drinks taste fine, but they are too expensive for what they are.  The food was very bland - like it was just frozen food from  Costco heated up.  I should have figured from the location, it was really just a place to fleece tourists of money.  In case the prices aren't already high enough, they add a 20% service charge to the bill regardless of the size of the party.  Never again.
author: John D.

description: We absolutely loved it!! Great costumer service. The martinis were a great bang for their buck. The pizza was great! I love crispy pepperoni so it was awesome. Great time:)
author: Taylor W.

description:
Been here quite a few times and have brought different peeps with me.

Was there yesterday with 2 girlfriends. We were "Shopping till you drop" and it was one of my friends birthdays.

We were met at the door by the very friendly Sam. Found 3 seats at the bar and had smiling faces behind the bar welcoming us and Roxanne remembered me. Got drinks right away and when Rox found out it was my friends BD, she said.... First drink on me!

Sam came over later and told us about his Wine and gave us a complimentary glass paired with some cheese.

My friends were very impressed and I am sure will be stopping here again in the future as a small break from shopping.
author: Megan T.

description: We ran into this cool bar about a year or two ago and now every time we go back to the city we have to hit this place up. My fiancé loves their pear martini and I just love the place.  If you are lucky enough to be there when Sam the owner is there, you are in for a great treat. Sam is a outgoing, wonderful man who instantly makes you feel like he is your best friend and you are a guest at his house. Sam is a very successful businessman who has various businesses outside this bar varying from a tattoo salon to a very successful Vietnamese restaurant in Los Gatos yet he is from Greece just to show you how versatile he is. He also makes extraordinary wine. Make sure you try it when you are there, it is a caliber well beyond what you would expect to find in this highly touristy area and you will be delightfully surprised.
author: Tony D.

description: We came here on Saturday night. Not too crowded! We were greeted by a nice hostess. I ordered Irish Coffee that was amazing! My friend got raspberry mojito which was great too. And we asked for half price of a glass of wine for checking in on Yelp. The waitress just brought one and she said it's complimentary!
author: Jeff S.

description:
Best Cosmo's ever!!! We stepped in because it started to rain, so why not have a drink?? What a great little gem. The Martini's and Cosmo's were made to perfection, which is difficult to find. We were given snacks; a bag of popcorn and plate of cheese. 

The owner was very nice. The staff is wonderful and the patrons were friendly as well. It feels comfortable like your neighborhood bar, casual but definitely not a dive. I will definitely come back when I return to SF. We are the tourist they trapped, but had a great time! So be aware of all the additional charges. We didn't mind, we expected to pay a lot for everything while in SF.
author: Denise A.

description: Don't let the obnoxious sign out front fool you. It's a pretty chill bar. It has an old school feel... I would describe it as a kitschy hipster sports bar. The mule and gimlet are awesome!
author: Ashley Michelle J.

description: Great service, great bar. Reasonable prices. I loved the bartender named Fern who was super kind and excited to be there. Made me happy to be there too.
author: Lysandra S.

description:
Best bar ever. 
Beautiful Thai bartender. 
Warm welcoming service. 
They watched my bag when I went to the bathroom with HOT water to wash my filthy MUNI hands. 

Great spot to go potty and slam a Jamo. 
Aces
author: James S.

description: I stayed in the hotel across the street this past weekend so Sam's Cable Car Lounge became my go-to spot when I needed to kill time and to watch the Warrior's game this weekend. If you like peanuts, popcorn, beer, and sports, this is a good pitstop inbetween stops while you bar hop.
author: Jessica I.

description:
My cousin and I were about ready to walk home when we saw Sam's.  Initially I thought it was a cable car gift shop but a few squints of my eye revealed wine & cigar.


I'll try to add more later but long story short one drink easily went to three, Sam's a wonderful proprietor and takes good care of his customers. 



Security is awesome.  I'll have to add this to my union square routine. :)
author: Jamille G.

description: What a ripoff! I've never heard of a service charge and tax on two cocktails at the bar! Especially over priced drinks to begin with!
author: alex f.

description: Elizabeth is the best. Very friendly and knowlegable of wines and San Francisco. We recived fast services and free popcorn ummm yummy. The drink was just rite. Love the music and great view of Powell street. Can't wait to visit again. I will be back for HAPPY HOUR.
author: Tippy T.

description: My husband and I were walking back to our hotel. We were on a weekend getaway without the kids so we in the mood for a bit of an adventure. We just happen to walk by Sam's and decided to have an after dinner cocktail. We were welcomed at the door which made us feel special. Lucky for us there was a vacant spot at the main bar. The bartender was sweet and whipped up our drinks fast. They were great. And she would stop by and ask if we were doing OK. It was a great experience and we plan to make this our go-to spot when we are in town.
author: Juana L.

description: I was visiting San Francisco for my birthday and we stumbled across this bar since we were just walking around SF on a Friday afternoon. We were greeted by two very friendly bartenders. We told them it was my birthday and they were so nice to us the whole time. Drinks were good and strong. Service was great! I wanted to stay all day!
author: MariTess C.

description:
This place stunk, and the billing is shady.

Took me a while to get a drink order, I sat there a good 5 minutes while the 3 people behind the bar were chatting with other people who had already ordered and weren't ordering. 

I got a Pizza for dinner and it was over-priced and tasted like they got it out of the freezer section of the local grocery. However it was loaded with pepperoni so they get an extra star for actually putting topping on their pizza. Well them or whatever factory pre-made, froze it, then and shipped it to them.

I ordered two old-fashioneds with Bulleit rye and a $18 pizza and my tab was over $50. "WTF!" I'm thinking to myself, the drinks weren't that huge (granted the better whiskey warrants an extra charge). I notice something on my tab as a "service charge" to which I was later informed is basically an auto-tip at a 20% rate. 

So no matter how your service is, you'll be tipping them 20%, heads up on that. I always tip well but this still frustrates me. It makes sure they get a large tip out of you while not providing you the quality of service to warrant it. I'm not some hard-ass who comes around and expects the world out of my server for them to get a higher tip but I don't like my gratitude to be forced either. I won't be returning here and if I wasn't in such a pinch to find a place with a TV on my way back to my hotel I can't say I would have even gone in there in the first place. Much regret here on this visit.
author: Ryan H.

description: Just paid $39 for 3 beers and they automatically added a gratuity. Stop, before you walk in this bar save your kids college funds and go elsewhere.
author: Michael B.

description: Yes this place is nice . Elizabeth is great. Loving the place definitely recommend to this place
author: India B.

description: Unfortunately did not have the best experience here.. just wanted to grab a drink after a long day of Christmas shopping and this was the most nearby bar around. First they ask for my ID and almost reject me and look at me skeptically because they think it's fake (maybe I look very young? But I can guarantee it's a real drivers license) and then the bartender asked one of his co workers about my ID and it ended up being fine. I wasn't too offended from that and still decided to stay, then I order my drink which lists at $8.75 for a "sex on the beach." After I received the bill I noticed it came out to $11.92..... wait what? I then read the bottom of the receipt and it says that they charge a whopping 22% service charge (which is optional but there were no signs that indicated anything about the service charge) plus tax on top on that. I didn't mind paying it but it discourages tipping extra and is a bit sneaky since the drink menu didn't include there would be an extra service charge..
author: Chelsea T.

description: Free popcorn and peanuts takes some of the pinch out of the $9 pints of Lagunitas. Stopped in here while waiting for my wife to wrap up at Cowboys and Angels. Realized this tourist trap holds no secret pearls for locals. The staff was nice enough and the service was quick. So take it as it is...
author: Matthew T.

description: Elizabeth was a great ambassador who took care of us she was ver social and made us feel very comfortable.  She helped us throughout he whole night and made us feel very welcomed.
author: Joshua M.

description: I love this place ... Always a great place to stop for a drink ... Staff was incredible .... Drinks were amazing .... Even the guy who checked my id was friendly and inviting ...music was poppin Highly recommended !!! Elizabeth was friendly I'll come back just to see her
author: Sam S.

description: Tourist trap like most places on Powell Street, walked in just to get a quick beverage, saw the prices and the mandatory 20% service charge and walked out.
author: J. B.

description: Awesome bartenders and service.  Love the music and will be back soon
author: Ken P.

description: I wouldn't bother, I never question the prices anywhere I go, so this was a first for me...not very good service, less than friendly staff, and please don't tack on gratuity for 2 people having a couple beers and not post it anywhere , I will tip you, good or bad...if I dont like, I simply won't be back....I won't be back
author: Larry K.

description: Absolutely appalling customer service. Rude unwelcoming door staff, followed by several pointless bar staff that totally ignored us - eventually got a drink but were the only couple on the entire bar not given snacks - not sure why since we had to leave a compulsory tip of 22% that is already applied to your cheque. AVOID AVOID AVOID
author: Amy B.

description: Came back just to see Elizabeth and luckily she was there! Great drink and great service! We will be back! Love, your Central Valley girls
author: Cassey V.

description: Excellent downtown bar!!!!  Came here two years ago during World Cup.  Back today and enjoying football. Fern makes an awesome Bloody Mary.  Fun getting snacks without asking.  We will be back!
author: Jim P.

description: Sam's is such a fun comfortable place! I go there every time I get off BART to hang out and grab a drink. Elizabeth, Jack and Nicki were so friendly and welcoming! I was also able to walk out with a great cigar for the night! Love this place!
author: Jessica S.

description: What? You don't like the fact that everyone working is a hot Asian chick? Are you not American? Who cares about the 20% forced tip be a man.
author: Steve W.

description: I had a wonderful time at Sam's! Elizabeth is the best hostess and we had so much fun kidding around with her! Thank you Elizabeth!
author: Christopher T.

description: Loved the atmosphere and the fast, friendly staff.. Great strong drinks. There was a great vibe. Will definitely come  back
author: Sandy W.

description: Our first time at Sam's. One of the coolest bars I've been to in the city. Great service, great choice of alcohol and friendly staff. What more can you ask for?
author: Cheryl T.

description: I stopped into this spot with a friend of mine when we needed a shopping break. We went in for happy hour and wow- their "house" wine is superb and apparently made by the owner. In addition, Elizabeth is the most hospitable server/ambassador I've had. I will definitely return.
author: Lucille C.

description: Sam's is the place in Union Square. shout out to Elizabeth best hostess ever. this place never diaaspaoints...appreciate locals and repeat customers!
author: Lou S.

description:
Its one of my favorite lounge in the city. I love the type of music they play-targets younger crowds. 
Very touristy atmosphere which i kinda like. 
I think their location is awesome. Its in the heart of downtown between all the shops so its a nice "hip" place to stop by and chill. 
Probably the friendliest staff at a bar!!! 
Cool music! 
Its a sports bar and there are tvs everywhere but at the same time its not. Everytime when we are there we dont feel like we're at a sports bar. 
They have happy hour.
During weekends, its busy and popular.
author: Anudari K.

description:
They are sooo amazing!!! Loved this place!! The staff was so friendly & the drinks were amazing (: 
Jack & Sam were the best!
author: Lauren W.

description: First time coming here and I was amazed by the service and the atmosphere here. The ambassador Elizabeth was amazing she was super friendly and polite. I would definitely come back again for the food and drinks, but most importantly the service was phenomenal.
author: Chris V.

description:
As a local, always a good stop by and bring my out-of-town buddies by to start the evening before din. The window spot is our fav for people watching.

The staff is so personable. Drinks and appetizers are reasonably priced in this tourist hot spot. 
The best seller is the staff, especially Salim and Sam. 

They have fun and creative drink specials. Don't forget the happy hour from 2-6.

Although the atmosphere is always bumping and lively, it can sometimes be a little much for the desired chill and hang energy.
Well worth the drive by...cheers.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
From the door man who asked to see my if, to the beautiful and hospitable Elizabeth, this place is a great stop for cocktails.. and the mai tai is out of this world!! 
I'll be back, tomorrow lol
Thanks Sam
author: Rand H.

description: Elizabeth is the best! Well worth a visit to the Cable Car just for her! The drinks are awesome and the atmosphere rocks!
author: Neena W.

description:
What was I thinking when I suggested my man friend to check this place out! Maybe I was intrigued by the colorful lights but that's where it ends for me. 

The drink menu is rather small consider the ample liquor bottles surrounding the bar. We decided to get 2 draft beers and our total came out to $20!!!! WTF was written all over my face! Okay, I get that this is located right in the heart of the tourist trap but that's just ridiculous! Call me a cheapo but that was my first and final time here.
author: Katie N.

description:
I know this is a tourist place but please, no mandatory tipping without letting the customer know!(is that legal?)The prices are very high already,sheesh. But there's free popcorn!
Mr. Jack M, no deception please, (most if not all people are not going to look for "disclaimer" signs,WTF?)and please consider serving ALL the people of San Francisco, not only deep pocket tourists.Take a lesson from the "Gold Dust Lounge".
In SF, that s#/t doesn't fly baby!
author: Mag N.

description:
I like this place! It fulfills its purpose: it's a nice bar and it's near union square. The plane decor on the ceiling is a nice touch to its skyline pictures on the wall.

I've come here twice, and would rate it higher, but after reading other reviews, I was a little shocked by the 18% service charge. That means I so overpaid for my couple of drinks, and the drinks are already pricey.

My only other complaint is the opposite of what other yelpers are saying. I found that they made their drinks really strong. I've got a pretty good tolerance, but last night I only had two Lemon Drops and felt pretty drunk after. I'm even hungover today. Usually I'm fine within a few hours.

Maybe other places have been giving me weak drinks and this place is the real deal? Either way, I suppose it's just something to consider. I didn't want to be hungover today. Maybe next time I'll stick to good ole beers.
author: Jessica S.

description: Such an unexpected experience that made a long day so worth the risk of walking in to settle down with a beer. Elizabeth and staff from entrance to exit provided so much attention and positivity that led me to be able to enjoy a glimpse into the beautiful and peaceful wine cellar that inspired me to buy some quality wine. What a difference great customer service and do to change someone's day in tough times. Thank you
author: James B.

description: Elizabeth, jack and nikki were the friendliest I've ever encountered. Greeted upon entering the bar and the rest of my experience was filled with jokes and good times and I will definitely come back and look for them.
author: Neal F.

description:
Love this place, my favorite spot in SF, Jack the manager very friendly and also great person, I would love to say hello to Roxane, Sabin, Tu, Selim, Michelle and Laura.

Love you guys
author: Ercan V.

description: Awesome place great staff !!!!!! So much fun!!!!! Great fun place to stop in!!!!!!!!   Loved the atmosphere and the drinks. Irish coffee hit the spot in a Cold evening:..
author: R V.

description: The ambiance and tv's are pretty good. Service was alright to.(we sat at the bar) But damn its expensive. $20 for a pizza that tasted right outta the box. Not even the quality of pizza hut. But the bad part is we get the bill and there is a 22% service charge added! No where were we told before we sat down that was the case. At the bottom it says if you dont want to pay it they can take it off. Ok. Bartender says he cant. After making it clear im not paying the bill if he doesnt he miraculously takes it off. Amazing how that works. Just total greed. The food wasnt worth the bill let alone a 22% increase. They must fool ppl with this all the time. Be on the lookout ppl. Check your bill or just save the time and order dominos. Lame
author: Chunkymunky F.

description:
Only good thing about this place is the number of Tvs and the music.

The bartenders literally are paid to stand around.  I tried to order a beer at the bar from 2 bartenders who were just standing there, and they curtly told me to sit at a table and wait for a waitress.  Then they went back to standing around. After I ordered with the waitress, the bartender brought my drink. That's a stupid division of labor.

Also, 14 dollars for a weak martini is extortion. 

The bouncer out front is unnecessary.  

Food is insanely priced even for union square and tastes like school lunches.

Fail.
author: Alexander W.

description: One of the worst bars in the city where they add several fees and a tip to your check
author: John O.

description: Great place to have a drink and hang out downtown after shopping. Really friendly people. Elizabeth the ambassador hook it up with two fire ball shots
author: Jorge R.

description: Our server Elizabeth was extremely welcoming and a great server she made sure we were taken care of the whole time. Great service and great drinks.
author: Rainil S.

description:
2 for the lovely ladies checking up on us. 

Over priced.
No real selection for appetizers. 
Bell ringing gets annoying quick.
22% service fee charge AUTOMATIC
author: Citlali M.

description: Buyer beware! Watch out tourists! I'm a local and This place will gouge you! Beers are more expensive than the airport! $ 9.75 and then they add tax to it, which tax should already be in the price of the beer if no food is ordered, and then a 22% service charge!  I had one beer and asked for the bill and the total was $12.95!  The servers are very nice and it's definitely not their fault, they provide individual popcorn and nuts, which is very kind, but the owners are preying on tourists not checking or knowing any different.  I told them I was a local and very disturbed by what they are doing, in a nice way to the kind servers, and they quickly took off the service charge. That is still not enough when your drinks are more money than a 5 star restaurant or AT&T park! It's just rude and I was shopping with my family visiting in Union Square.  I rarely post anything negative, but they have to be stopped taking advantage.
author: Cameron A.

description:
Will never go back. Staff was friendly enough but we get the bill for 3 IPA drafts and it costs over $30. Well, when examining the bill, they tack on a 22% "service charge" which is complete bs. 

We will be disputing this charge with our credit card issuing bank.
author: Pat B.

description: So glad I checked Yelp and found this place! Thank you Yelp and thank you Sam! Such nice people working here. Fantastic wines, ask for sir fox brand Cabernet. Cheese, popcorn and peanuts free with drinks. Ordered the meat lovers pizza and I expect it to be very good. Prices are very good for this area. Elizabeth was very helpful and was so much fun to chat with. Consider yourself lucky if she is working when you make it here. I recommend this place very highly!
author: Jebediah C.

description: This was a big disappointment. The food was overpriced. $15 for a sandwich with chips; the chips were a small bag of Lays. The sandwich was good, but not worth the money. The service was slow and the interior was super tacky. Not worth your time.
author: Gareth P.

description: This place sucks... I stopped by there to get a quick beer. The price was around 6$ dollars which is acceptable for the city. However; when I got my bill it included a service charge 2$ + tax. So it is definitely a tourist trap ...
author: George B.

description:
Unless you want to pay $7+ for a beer and your tip is included without notice, RUN! Regular beer anywhere else for $5.

Also, just so tacky. It's like the most touristy bar in the entire San Francisco...and of course, right on Powell. No. Unless you are desperate for beer and happen to be across the street.
author: Alexia R.

description:
I visited Sam's twice in the same weekend. The first time we visited, my friend and I were just looking for a neat spot to grab a glass of wine and appetizers right after a long week of work and the second time was on a Monday late morning/early afternoon. The ambiance was great both times! Friday evening was more lively and busy but the service and food were still good. We had the Pirozhkis and Sir Fox red wine and they were exceptional. I've never had Pirozhkis before but they definitely exceeded my expectations. On our visit Monday, we met Sam who told us the Sir Fox label is actually his wine and I don't think you can purchase it outside of the bar. He was very humble and great to chat with. Nicki was our bartender and she was great as well!

We definitely recommend anyone visiting/staying near Union Square to experience Sam's. Oh, HUGE PLUS - they serve complimentary cheese with your wine. I have never experienced this ever, even at the fancy restaurants we have in Las Vegas. We will definitely frequent Sam's from now on.
author: Justine B.

description: Great service, good people, bar staff so friendly and chatty. And great recommends, know their cocktail's and helps patrons out! Open til 2am on Fridays, great place to end the night and grab a pizza cross the road.
author: Rob C.

description: Came here after the Yelp event at the Gift Center to keep the party going! Really good vibe, very cool staff! Nicole and Charlie are both super cute and nice. There's a good crowd here on a Thursday night.. Would definitely come to pregame or to watch a game!
author: Athena L.

description: Owner is very friendly. Salim the bartender is awesome hooked it up with fireball shots to close out our last night of our trip to beautiful San Francisco, will definitely be back!!! Thank you
author: Ivy B.

description:
Union Square the the West Coast shopping destination, and Sam's Cable Car Lounge is located on Powell St. I have been coming here pretty much since they opened. The way the place is decorated put you in a relaxed mood, and there are three flat screens with whatever sport you want to watch. And the staff? The best. Jack and Sam are nice, but Inna, Blanca, Niki and Laura and Michelle are some of the nicest bartenders I have ever met! And they can mix up some tasty drinks to satisfiy the pickiest drinker.

Try their signature drink, the Cable Car Cosmo. Happy Hour runs Monday to Friday, 3pm to 7pm.
author: Tony V.

description:
Total rip off.  No atmosphere and $9 a beer......

The staff were ok, but would not recommend it to anyone.
author: Justin T.

description: Seriously 14.95 for a Beer? Went 2 blocks up to the Last Drop Tavern and Paid 6.00 for a Beer with better service. Seriously avoid at all costs! They'll try to sell you rotgut wine for 48.00  bottle and tell you it's a steal at 99.00  for 3.. Total ripoff, tourist trap...
author: Dave F.

description: Inexpensive, cool spot with good music. Came in on a Saturday and found a quick spot. Waitress was on top of it, got my drink in less than 5 mins. We checked in and also got the BOGO wine! Manager was super cool and gave us the deal even though it's on Monday-Thursday. Will definitely be coming back to this place.
author: Roxanne S.

description: I've must have passed by this place a dozen times prior and had never noticed it. Cool bar , bartender nice and friendly. Good selection of cocktails.
author: Robert G.

description: Sat down last night with a friend at a table. Waited about 10 min for a waiter to come by to take our drink orders but no one ever came (the bartenders were busy watching the game). I then went up to the bar and had to stand around for 5 min while the decided to ignore me. Finally got my drink orders in at which point the bartender said he would bring my drinks to the table. This place has the nerve to charge a mandatory 20% service charge. I understand they're right in union square so I wasn't expecting an amazing deal. But you need to have GOOD service in order to pull that off. Wouldn't come back here again.
author: Jonathan S.

description: Love this place! I have been here a couple times with my friends and my boyfriend and the service is always excellent! The wine is very good and they give you free cheese and popcorn! Truly a hidden gem in Union square!
author: Catalina M.

description: This place is HORRIBLE!   DO NOT COME HERE!  AUTOMATICALLY CHARGES YOU A 22% "Service Charge" tip on all tabs!  Go somewhere else. Plenty of great spots around here!  Spoke with manager Jack. He was less than helpful. He did say you can tell the waitress or bartender to remove the entire tip from your bill!
author: Scott H.

description:
Was in SF on a girls weekend for a friends. 40th.  We stumbled upon the place because of the retro "cocktails" sign we noticed from down the street.  The place looked packed but when we walked in the owner Sam directed us to the seat by the window.  He chatted with us and gave us complimentary glasses of his wine. It was great.  He refilled our glasses and gave us a bottle to go!  

We enjoyed the conversation and the wine.  I will be stopping in on my next visit to the city.  The cocktails and atmosphere were great as well!
author: Alexis K.

description:
Friendly service kept our snacks refilled without us having to ask (chips+salsa, popcorn, nuts) 
Decent-price happy hour beers
Cheesy "club" music

Not a fan if the 18% tip automatically added to our bill but I can understand why they would do it: this area is loaded with tourists from places that don't normally tip. At least the servers were nice and attentive so they earned the tip in my book.
author: Bonnie S.

description: The place has a decent ambiance and seems to be recently updated, however  I was very disappointed after I got to my hotel and realized that for my party of 3 they added the 20% service charge to my bill so I inadvertently added another 20%.  It is quite dark in there and I didn't notice this when i signed the bill. They really should have mentioned that gratuity was already added when the gave the bill to me, I can understand if it is a large party but it was just 3 of us.  Really who gives 40%+ tip on mediocore service!  Come on man! I guess they like to take advantage of tourists! For this reason I cannot recommend this place!
author: Craig M.

description: Elizabeth is THE BEST!!!! This bar is so fun and the staff is amazing. We had an amazing time, the alcohol selection is great and they have popcorn and nuts for patrons. Definitely worth stopping by!!!
author: Brittan E.

description: Elizabeth is the best. Made us feel like regulars. Definitely will come back. Highly recommend... ask for the wine tasting
author: Edy M.

description: Friendly and cosy, downtown watering spot with beautiful wait stuff and super-friendly hostess Elizabeth. Elizabeth, you are a real star! I'm coming back with friends. They have a wine cellar downstairs, I have to come and spend more time. Thanks!
author: glen g.

description: This place is on top of things!  My wife and I walked in and got treated like royalty! Fresh squeezed margarita made by Patty, PR greeting from Elizabeth and the top dog, Sam came over to greet us! Love this place. We will be back!
author: Jonny S.

description: Great place and with a great atmosphere!! The owner was a sweetheart !!! Thanks Sam for the great time!! And for the bottles of wine for my friends birthday!!!
author: Lizzy T.

description: First time here and I like this spot! The atmosphere is great the service was top notch. ELIZABETH was super attentive and friendly! The drinks were good. I would definitely come back here
author: Rick R.

description: All the good I can say is that the service was friendly. Overpriced drinks with a service charge included on the bill. This place is solely here to harvest tourist dollars and it made me a little sad that people leave SF with the idea that this is representative of the City bar experience.
author: Brian B.

description: Very helpful staff and excellent service. They give popcorn and peanuts with your drinks. Its a nice touch. Really good wine list. Thanks sams and i will come back
author: Danilo M.

description: Stopped into Sam's Cable Car Lounge to have a fast glass of wine before meeting a family member. I was presently surprised to have the owner Sam card me! I immediately noticed how customer focused his crew is and after speaking with him it was clear why. Every person who left the lounge he knew something about them. There are very few spots left in SF like this one. I will definitely come back and bring a friend!!
author: Tania H.

description: Elizabeth is fantastic ambassador to this lovely venue. Excellent ambience, great decor and to die for cocktails. Friendly staff. My friends and I will most definitely come back when we are in San Francisco. :)
author: Chonlatorn N.

description: They make their own wine! It's FANTASTIC!  Thank you Elizabeth for introducing me, I bought a bottle. Fern is a super sweet bartender. I will be back! PS they have super clean bathrooms!
author: Charity C.

description: Learned about this place on Yelp, tried it out and was not disappointed! We were greeted by a happy waitress Elizabeth with a big smile and a cheerful disposition! Drinks were great and the ambiance is exactly what I needed, that warm homey feeling! Highly recommend! A must when you are in SF!
author: Juan C.

description: Oh my God!!!!!! This place is off the hook and Elizabeth is Awesome!!!!!! Totally recommend it.
author: Jorge C.

description:
Place has potential...
Looks inviting from the outside. We stopped by in early afternoon and there were not too many people inside. The drinks were strong and flavorful. They give you complimentary peanuts and small popcorn bag while you are there. I think they should do something like give free snacks for the price of the drinks. $39 for two drinks (two flavored martinis). 
Maybe later in the evenings this place will draw more of a crowd.
author: Steven H.

description: Came by for a quick drink on a business trip. Very friendly staff. Especially Elizabeth (manager) was informative and a great representative for the establishment. Fun atmosphere without being too crazy. Great wine selection downstairs. Check it out!
author: William L.

description: Came by just for a few drinks and everyone was super cool and nice! Talked to the owner for a bit and he gave us free shots of fireball!! Such a cool place!
author: Lauryn N.

description:
BUYER BEWARE!!!! 18% SERVICE CHARGE?? For WHAT? This isn't a TAKE OUT establishment! 
I stopped in during the World Cup to meet a friend, and was immediately approached by a waitress regarding my drink order, when I told her I was waiting for a friend to join me within a few minutes, she insisted I needed to order right away or she would 'get in trouble'... WTF? I asked her if she was serious, and ordered an IPA. Got my beer and my friend showed up a second later, I told her of the high pressure sale. We decided right then and there to move on to a friendlier better value establishment! Got my check and then noticed the 18% SERVICE CHARGE (REALLY??)  plus tax and the SF healthcare mandate made my one high pressure beer more expensive and LESS PLEASANT than it should have been! :(    I understand this is tourist central and that NOT all cultures TIP, but TIPS are NOT COMPULSORY in SF or THE USA! I'm considered a generous and empathetic tipper when service is good/friendly, and think it WRONG to charge FOR SERVICE THAT SHOULD BE PROVIDED / INCLUDED in a dining and drinking establishment!! 
If you have deep pockets (or your dumb) you may find this place quite adequate, otherwise move on... you have plenty of options and vote with your money supporting those businesses that EARN your MONEY!!!
You might also notice that many of the HIGH RATED REVIEWS aren't from Yelp Elites or the more active and serious Yelpers!!!
CHEERS!
author: Sean M.

description: I just dropped into Sam's while waiting for a friend. This is an awesome place! I love the funky vibe it has plus the cute ladies working here. Elizabeth showed me around and she's the best! The extensive wine seller is also something that shouldn't be missed, and Elizabeth gave me a great tour.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Mick M.

description: We were having trouble finding a place to grab a quick drink after walking around quite a bit.  I knew it was a pretty touristy area but I was desperate.  Inside the place was big and had plenty seating so we decided to get a drink.  I had the pear martini- it was good about average for a drink but it was 14$ and not THAT good.  After a total of 3 drinks we left there with a 38$ tab including tip.  To me for the quality that's wayyy over priced, but in that area that's what your going to get.  I will give them extra points for free popcorn and peanuts though!!!
author: Kate F.

description: awesome bar/lounge.  Very friendly service here. Nice place to grab a beer or cocktail. They have free peanuts And popcorn which was a plus!! Great way to start NYE!!!
author: Wendy M.

description: It has great service and a fantastic ambience. The owner and staff are super friendly! Good prices too! Plus the owner has a private label winery that is phenomenal!!
author: Janet R.

description: Drinks were good , however food was bland pizza was 20.00 for a pepperoni and I swear it was  a frozen Toni's straight from the box. Good atmosphere and lots of TVs to watch the game fun hangout but food was overpriced and be careful they automatically ad 20% to the bill so be careful not to double tip .
author: Shawn M.

description: My Mom, sister, and I came here on vacation and even before we walked in the door, Elizabeth greeted us, made sure we were served, and checked on throughout our entire stay. We felt like royalty! This is such a unique place and the atmosphere is perfect for any occasion! The owners are also wine makers and the happy hour specials (from 2-6) are pretty reasonable. We had beer, wine and pizza and even went home with a case of wine. Jason, the manager was a sweetheart! Definitely a stop before you leave.
author: Mandy H.

description: This place was great! Snacks, popcorn, nuts right away.  Friendly staff, the perfect place to stop in and grab a drink while hiking around Union Square!
author: Kathy F.

description:
My friends and I stopped by here last night before heading to Infusion.

$15 for one drink, incredibly rude and pompous doorman in a cheap suit that tried to make signals about us behind our back (an over the top and over the hill telenovela villain looking guy wearing glasses) and a REALLY wierd vibe inside on a Saturday night.

Our bad for wandering into a Union Square tourist trap!
author: Mailah G.

description:
This place should be put out of it's misery.  It is a poor example of what a bar should be.  Lacking any comfort,  it's decor should be sent back to the Chinese container ship from where it came. 
My only experience there was ordering a glass of wine.  I felt that the staff were so unhappy,  one person took my order for the glass,  another gave it to me and then I waited patiently to pay with a third person!   Wow,  so personable.   I wonder if the owner even gives a damn.  No passion.  Avoid.
author: keith g.

description:
Came in here for a mini vacation!
Staff is great and the music was super fun. My girlfriend and I are 27 and we were looking for a fun spot! 
Elizabeth helped us out and took good care of us! Elizabeth and the rest of the staff were amazing, this bar is definitely worth checking out!
author: Nick P.
