description: Elizabeth is just the most sweetest host! The best drinks in downtown. Trust me! Come check it out
author: Carlos A.

description: The service was amazing here (and the bathrooms super clean ) cute spot right next to time square Elizabeth was super helpful and made r time here enjoyable !!!!
author: Mckenzie S.

description: This place is kinda okay and the drinks are not so great. I like the little cigar corner, it has a little flavor to it. Sports bar, lots of stuff on TV going on.
author: Tiff W.

description: Great vibe & friendly workers. Free popcorn & peanuts. You can't beat that with 6 large screen TV. You can't beat that. Elizabeth is friendly & helpful. Ask for Elizabeth if you need help with a smile.
author: Theng Y.

description: Had 1 beer. 16oz $5.50 drafts for happy hour. Lost a star for the 18% added gratuity. I was going to tip $1 anyway but still felt cheap not adding another $1 on top of the service charge. I guess it does have tourist trap written all over it. Not a ad place to grab a drink though.
author: Mike M.

description:
Wow, this place is truly awful. We did notice the 18 percent auto-tip and health charge right away. But the service was friendly and terrible. I asked what kind of veggies were on the veggie pizza and the waitress said "it's a mix, already on the pizza." When I said that wasn't my question, she turned to talk to another table. The same thing happened later. When i said we weren't told about being charged for a soft drink refill, she said the automatic tip is stated on the menu. Um, sounds more like a recording than a person.

The veggies were good, but it was hard to find the pizza under all the vegetation.
author: Robert C.

description: Best drinks and town and the best hostess with the mostest Elizabeth, she made my family and I feel welcomed into a new city love every aspect of this bar!
author: Annabel F.

description: Elizabeth the waitress is fucking awesome. And the drinks are drinks but a fun place and a break from all the walking
author: Seung G.

description: Everyone here is great! Great spot to hang after a long work day. Plus free pop corn and peanuts! Make sure you say Hi to Theresa on the way in, she will take care of you!
author: Megan D.

description: Is my first time in these  place and i like it the personal is very nice and atentive specialy elizabeth the lady who serve us drinks im definitle coming back
author: Maria L.

description: Jack is the bomb, love him and all of the people that work here. So sweet to clean up a spot at the bar before we sat down. Loved this place and great conversation with all of the people that work here! Come here!!!! It's amazing!!!
author: Michelle M.

description:
We were ready to leave before our drinks arrived...
the guy at the door told us to pick a table, then we waited for ten minutes for someone to come and give us a menu. then waited more than five minutes to be asked what we would like to order...and have both menus taken from us. good thing we had already decided to move on after one round. it wasnt even that busy. 
FYI, this place automatically includes 18% service tip to your bill... despite not actually offering a service! Im not one to pay for something I do not recieve. Worst place I found in SF!
author: Bec A.

description: being a local in san francisco, i love this spot. its in the middle of downtown, how can you not spot by! it's a lovely sports bar with a good sense of atmosphere. the bartenders, bar backs, and hostess are all great! thanks so much to PJ, Dave, Jack, Fern, Elizabeth, Christian, Charlie, Danny and the whole staff for the great service!!
author: Grace C.

description: Lui and Elizabeth are amazing! Great service, friendly staff and the best local bar experience I've had in a long time!! Very impressed...
author: Michael B.

description: If I could go less than one star I'd welcome the opportunity to review this place. The door man was beyond a jackass and costs this place untold business.  Get him a therapist or a baseball bat to the face.
author: John B.

description: Drinks are too expensive- 10 bucks for a beer!! 70s music only if that's you're thing but no one is dancing nor is there a place to dance (I was here Saturday night). Decent crowd but everyone is pretty much to themselves. It has nice decor and lots of TVs, but it's a very small space. Wouldn't recommend.
author: Lani F.

description: Holy crap!! San Francisco has been fun but my best experience is here, I wish I could take this place home with me, The staff is amazing, The drinks are actually affordable and The atmosphere is amazing! I highly recommend coming here if you're looking for a good time and staff that treat you as if your family! When I think of San Francisco I will always think of Sam's cable car!
author: Kim C.

description: best bar in SF, bartenders are super nice, great drinks. Elizabeth is super welcoming! Need to come here if in the city. It's a must! Great prices on drinks!!
author: Alexis K.

description: The drinks were delicious!!!!!! Couldnt have beeen any better!!!!!! Raspberry mojito was delicious!!! Elizabeth helped us out and she was great!!! She was awsome!!!! So nice and so sweet!!! Thank you Elizabeth for your help you are great!!!!
author: Lili V.

description: Hostess Elizabeth the GREAT was such a great host service was excellent great atmosphere n vibe
author: Sean M.

description: Happy hour lists that well drinks as $5.95. They have a drink menu that lists a bunch of usual drinks (mojito, mai tai, Manhattan, long island, AMF, etc) as being made with Well Liquor UNLESS SPECIFIED. We did not specify anything out of the ordinary and were charged full price even after talking with the manager.
author: Paul R.

description:
Great family owned bar!! Great staff and Saleem is a gentleman! 

Check it out if your killing time or just want to relax. My bf comes here when he's waiting for me to get off of work!
author: Semi P.

description:
This place was great! My boyfriend an I stumbled upon it on our trip to San Francisco as thirsty tourists walking thru union  square. I came in, and I immediately noticed 18% charge for all orders. I'm glad I noticed and asked what it was, with so many tourists from all over the world, many times the bartenders would not get tipped. We all know that bartenders work solely on tips, which is the reason for that rule. 4 stars because if you don't notice that, it is likely you'll tip on top of that. 

We came in during 'happy hour' 11-7pm which meant $4.50 drafts, descent for SF, and where I'm from. We stayed here for a few beers, and even had the opportunity to meet the owner, which was pretty cool! He was personable and friendly and talked to us about the other restaurants he owned. I overall appreciated the experience because not often do you get to meet the owner of an establishment. 

My experience overall was 5 stars because of the pleasant wait staff, descent prices, nice owner, and it was a clean establishment.
author: Julia C.

description:
Ridiculous Prices - They give you peanuts and popcorn so you will keep ordering drinks........

* Extra Charge just because "It's a Martini" $1.50 more on top of your drink price
* Svc Chg 20% -Included- if you don't notice it, you will tip on top of that
* SF Mandates chg = Employer mandate to pay health insurance=so WE pay for it

Pushy waitress hoovers over your table to order more drinks.

Would not go back....
author: Kristy D.

description: Elizabeth the best hostess in San Fran. Thank you for making our stay so fun and entertaining! Cheers! All the best to this awesome place. Good bar food and good happy hour drinks!
author: George P.

description: Great spot on Union Square. Good, relaxed vibe. We stopped in on the way to dinner for the wife's birthday. The owner gave us two glasses of excellent 94 point wine and cheese. This was in addition to the standard popcorn and nuts. Bartenders were great as well!
author: Andrew And Kristen C.

description: Thank you so much Elizabeth and team! We came in on a VERY busy Saturday night and we were greated right away! Frees snacks and amazing drinks! We got great seats at the bar. Overall excellent service!!! I felt so important! Thank you!!!
author: Monica P.

description: My girl friend and I are traveling from Palm Springs CA & This bar is hands down the best. Spending our last hour in the city here and it was been amazing. From the drinks to service to all around awesome place to be. Elizabeth is such a happy soul. Her energy is just so contagious. The bar tenders are so good at what they do and very efficient. I have nothing but good things to say about this. YOU GUYS ARE AWESOME!!!!!!! I love San Fran
author: Joanna G.

description:
I love a good drink and am willing to pay for quality.  But when each drink is over $18 and then a mandatory 18% service charge AND some other mandatory charge of 4%....that's where I draw the line.  When you read reviews that say $79 for "a shot" and "we had a few shots" then you know this isnt even for your average well paid professional...this is for people who are making so much they dont care.  I cannot speak to the tastiness of the cocktails as I walked out.  I have read one of the responses the bar made to a patron, and it was quite rude!!  They wouldnt let the guy watch the last 15 mins of a basketball game without ordering a drink and they were RUDE about it.  I despise paying money to a business that is both RUDE and so horrendously overpriced that its offensive.  
Oh, and Me (40 years old) and my mother (64 years old) were carded before we were allowed to walk in.  WALK IN.

I got a lovely response from  this establishment. If you choose to be spoken to like this while spending your hard earned money, go right ahead. This patron deserves and expects more courtesy. And I'm from Philly where being rude is an art
author: Rina C.

description:
I really wanted to like this place since it was so close to our hotel. But we just can't. Four beers and two shots cost us $75. Yes there is a service charge that was added, supposedly it's not mandatory. But when I asked about it she didn't take it off our check. The music was way too loud and so not appropriate for this type of "sports bar/lounge". The basketball game was on and they were blaring techno. I was confused...should we be dancing or lounging?? 
I'm sure I'll get a rude remark like others who did not give a 5 star review. But I'll risk it. I give honest reviews. If you are looking for a laid back fun atmosphere with decent priced drinks move on. If money is no object this is your place.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Great customer service and atmosphere! Elizabeth very friendly and recommended places for us to visit on our travel.
author: Trinidad E.

description: Me and my friends came from Los Angeles for a nice getaway and decided to stay at the Hilton hotel near Powell st. One of our most stop places was here at SAMs cable car lounge... Good atmosphere, bartenders are always making sure you're ok and ELIZABETH  was the best, she was sweet and very friends. I Definitely will come back!
author: Wilbert R.

description: Poor place. Smelly and dirty. Visiting SF. Won't recommended to anyone.
author: Krasi Y.

description: Awesome service. Great happy hour prices (M-F 2pm-6pm) for being right in the heart of downtown! They provided complementary popcorn and peanuts too!
author: Sam H.

description: Great service!!!!!! Friendly staff. Place yo be if you're on vacation!!! Mgr. Jack. Elizabeth, Mathias wonderful!!! Awesome strong drinks. Great pour!
author: Lynne K.

description:
There is an expression "hidden gem" - well, this is a diamond in a plain view. Right off the Union square, a wonderful place - cosy, elegant, Americana-style interior (but not over the top, very elegant). Beautiful friendly bartenders, small and refined menu, and a very impressive enoteca with very diverse array of wines from all over the world - European (French, German, Italian), Californian, Australian. From very affordable to the creme de la creme luxurious. We tried both chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon from the estate winery of the owner. The brand is called Sir Fox. Only 220 boxes are made every year, so it's pretty special. We can highly recommend it - no headache next morning. 
Special thanks to the manager Elizabeth - an epitome of hospitality, wine knowledge, and friendliness. She gave us a tour around the wine cellar, recommender lighter wines, and told about the impressive decor of the bar. 
Great place, whether you are a tourist or a local.
author: Lisa K.

description: We stumbled upon this place and were pleasantly surprised. Great drinks, fun staff and very clean.  Owners were there and were very accommodating. Salim was so nice and really cared about our experience. He is awesome! So glad we found this place. We'll be back next trip!
author: Mama M.

description: Great Bar, great atmosphere. If you wanna relax in a chill environment, I'd definitely recommend.
author: Chris F.

description: This is me and my best friends favorite spot! If you come in, make sure Elizabeth (server) is working! She's awesome! Friendly and has great recommendations !! The food is yummmmyyyyy
author: Pearl O.

description: The music is awesome. Thanks Nikki for the delicious cucumber & basil martinis and service with a smile! Jack makes a Great Manhattan! Sam, I want to go to your wine house. Mamma your sweet. Thx for making me feel welcome with Lee.
author: Claire L.

description:
Was charged $24 for a raspberry mojito and a Sprite. A little high, but okay. My girlfriend decided to order a second mojito, so I asked for a refill on the Sprite. Got charged for it again. It definitely wasn't a mistake or anything.

Being charged full price for a second soft drink, when they charge $4 for them and have a 18% mandatory gratuity, is disappointing.

Too bad. It's a decent place otherwise.
author: Joshua W.

description: This place amazing. Our bartender Salim was a nice guy, kept checking in on us. Overall great place to come whole in SF
author: Anthony B.

description: Awesome service! Warm and friendly staff and stylish decor create comfortable ambiance. Top that off with a great menu and this is a destination of choice for after-work cocktails!
author: Glenda C.

description: Went here for the first time on Tuesday. I have to say, that I'm very impressed! It was my cousin's birthday and they gave us a complimentary glass of champagne, as well as cute little bags of popcorn and cheddar cheese. Can I also say that they play 90s alternative music?? It brought back great memories. Anyways I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for great music, service and food!
author: Chiamaka N.

description: My friend and I stumbled upon Sam's Cable Car Lounge on our way shopping and so glad we did! It was happy hour--we got 2 beers for around 14 bucks. We met Sam the owner and he was talked with us and others in the bar which was nice! He was making sure everyone had a good time. The bar played some good music and also gives out complimentary popcorn and peanuts to go with your drinks! (or cheese with your wine order) ..overall a fun little bar and a nice place to drop in. They also had a few flatscreen tvs around for sports lovers. I'll be back!
author: Nancy V.

description: Great customer service! Most convenient location (right near union square). Sam is super sweet and very accommodating and personable. The staff goes out of their way to make sure that their customers have a great experience. They have a nice happy hour menu with reasonably priced drinks. I will definitely be back! I recommend the Cosmo.
author: Anne L.

description: STIFF DRINKS... yup.  pretty cool bar, from what i remember.
author: Claudia M.

description:
This is one of my go to bars in union square when j come to the city. My last visit was by far one of thee best. Bartenders were friendly. We met Sam the owner and he was soo generous. My girlfriends and I intended to go in take a quick shot and go on with our shopping but Sam and the bartenders made us feel so relax we stayed for a few extra! They even gave us fireball shots on the house for my it being my birthday week! Love it. Great vibe and complimentary snacks were great!
Definitely a place we'll visit in the city! :)
author: Stephanie S.

description: Great place to check out when in San Francisco. The service is great, yet chill. You don't feel pressured to be any kind of way. The drinks are amazing. For sure one of my favorite bars in union square.
author: Karina R.

description: Decided to take a break from Christmas shopping and crowds and came across Sam's cable car bar and stopped for drink.   Within minutes we were greeted by the sweetest host Theresa who made us feel so special and welcomed.    The owner Sam also came out and greeted us.   The hospitality was Behring amazing.   The ambiance, service and drinks are excellent.   We stopped for a quick drink and ended up staying for over three hours due to the hospitality.   This is for sure our little treasure find spot in the city and we will return.   If you stop by make sure you say hello to the kindest woman in the city.....Theresa!
author: Sara N.

description: Elizabeth is an awesome waitress! Love this place. Very convenient, great location and great food!!!
author: Jennifer G.

description: Yes, it's a tourist trap, but it's convenient if you are staying in one of the area hotels.  The lady at the front checked our ID's and we were immediately seated at a small table.  It was Saturday night, so it was pretty packed.  Some college games had wrapped up and ESPN and NFL network were on the many TVs.  House music played in the background for people to bob their heads to.  Prices are what you might expect for a hotel bar, $5 for a beer $7 for my Malibu and pineapple juice.  They add 18% gratuity which kind of stinks.  Service was good and you will meet people from around the world who have traveled to SF which is nice.
author: Bianca S.

description: Man the cable car lounge is a great place to drink & have popcorn to have your snack. You guys should check it out.
author: Mychael H.

description:
Sam's was THE place to be for Santacon.  Luckily my friend and I got there just as Sam was opening the door, he asked us in and showed us to the best seats in the house, then got us water, peanuts, and popcorn.
He stayed and complimented us and talked to us about a vacation we are getting ready for, giving good travel advice ... while continuing to refill our peanuts, so thoughtful.  
He also gave us each a souvenir from his travels to Thailand.
Love, Love this place will make it a staple stop each time we come to SF.
author: Annie O.

description: This place is amazing. Great service, drinks, and food. We came when it was a little slower and got to meet everyone. Complimentary popcorn and peanuts and cheese with wine. Amazing!
author: Allie E.

description: Love the guy with the piercing. Love the atmosphere met the most amazing people here. If you want to have a lovely time downtown you can come in and lounge, plus the bartenders are cute!!
author: Yessica N.

description: Elizabeth was our server here and made it such an enjoyable experience! Sam's is now my favorite go to bar downtown! The environment is very laid back and is the perfect after work getaway. Can't wait to come back next weekend!
author: G R.

description: Me and the gals at work love coming here! The private, house wines are delicious and the workers are wonderful - especially Sam himself. Free popcorn, peanuts, and cheese with our wine are the little things that make this place so special, aside from the 80's music we request that they play! Non-drinkers can enjoy the cranberry-orange juice, delicious! Even though this is in a touristy area, you'll find great locals here. We love Sam's!
author: Regina A.

description: Service was slow and not really friendly. Drinks here were okay but they have a mudslide on the menu that's not even blended. . Gross. Don't go out of your way to visit but they did give me free cold popcorn though.
author: Rachel K.

description:
Sam's Cable Car Lounge is right around the corner from my job so one day I stopped in for a drink on my way home and everyone there was so friendly.  Even though the bar is in the center of the tourist madness with union square and the Powell street cable car which passes right in front of Sam's on a regular basis the staff are very friendly and take the time to talk with everyone that comes in.  The owner actually makes his rounds and sits down with guests and chats with them as if they were old friends.
Oh yeah and the Cable Car Cosmo is AWESOME!
author: Pilalak B.

description:
We were looking for a good bar to get our night started so we started here..

 It wasn't too crowded at all, we got a table for 4 pretty quick, the waiter was really nice and gave us complimentary hot popcorn and peanuts. I ordered a cable car martini, which was ok.. it tasted exactly like grape kool-ade. One friend ordered a margarita, when it came it looked like foggy water with a lime! My sister ordered a gin gimlet, and when she got it they didn't strain it so it was full of mint and cucumber floaties. My last friend ordered a lemon drop, which she said tasted like cheap vodka.

Well we drank everything anyways and when the bill was left at our table we saw that they add on their own SF tax, a service tax, and regular tax!!! $62 for the 4 of us, not even worth it in my opinion! 

So if the ONLY reason ur going is for the free hot popcorn and peanuts, then great! If you're going for the drinks, I would try somewhere else
author: Broncofantay M.

description: Visited on our first night in SF, and went back the second night. Great service, reasonably priced drinks, and lively atmosphere.
author: Ashley R.

description: Great service from "the boss" and the bartenders. Came in with a bunch of loud people that love to laugh and they joined in with us. Good location that's very conveniently close to union square. 6 tv screens to enjoy the games. Good in my book.
author: Vik S.

description:
Just wanted to say thanks for a great night!!! 
There was a little bit of confusion with our tab at the end of the night but the manager was so quick to fix it and answer my questions! Beyond helpful and accommodating...I would definitely go back :) 

Leslie
Vacaville, ca
author: Leslie M.

description: My first visit to this bar and I'm impressed. The owner introduced himself to me and he is a complete gentleman. The service is fast and Sam makes some great wine. Complimentary cheese, peanuts and popcorn are a plus too! Going to make this a regular place to visit.
author: Katie H.

description: My girlfriends and I came here on a whim. We met the loveliest guy- the owner- who chatted up a storm with us. We enjoyed chatting with him and would recommend this place to others- a hole in the wall! Go there!!!
author: Martha O.

description: Stumbled upon this place by accident... Was a little lost and looking for a place to rest my feet. Walked in here and had an awesome Mojito. In the last hour every single person on staff took a moment to stop and chat with me! Not to mention the stellar food suggestions! I will be back to explore the tasting room upstairs very soon
author: Jenna K.

description: Everyone from their 20s to 70s comes here. Good vibes and great drinks and great service. The owner Sam makes sure that every guest is taken care of and a pleasure to meet. Will come back!
author: Siena B.

description: Wow! The service! The customer experience! !!! Beyond expectations for sure!   I came to have a drink before ice skating in union square and the staff here made me feel as I was part of the team!!! I will definitely be returning here shorty!  Five start to the best bar in town!!!!
author: Edith B.

description:
We had the most amazing experience at this place since we visited with the actual owner, Sam, when we were there! He is a character and made our day!! We live in SF and yes this is a touristy place and yes the drinks are not happy hour prices but what do you expect people when you are at ground zero for the main tourist area in SF?! Yes there is a gratuity included for the drinks but that is only due to the foreign tourists who don't tip and who are not from tipping cultures. How do you expect to keep a staff when they rely solely on their tips? 

This place has amazing service and I credit that to Sam, the owner, who seems very hands on with his businesses. Since living in SF for the last three years we never expected to stumble upon a place on Powell where we could meet a true SF character, but we did. We will be returning very soon. If you are so lucky to land in this bar while Sam is there, you have hit the jackpot my friends. He has pearls of wisdom to share about relationships, business and life in general. You may not be smarter, but you will be a better person from the exchange. Pay the gratuity and enjoy your $12 drink. It is worth it.
author: Shannon K.

description: Met Sam who is completely approachable friendly and welcoming. He is a private pilot! As an airline pilot who travels the world and visits bars across the globe, hands down this bar is a must.... Great decor great service great fun! Must see!!!!
author: Greg A.

description:
Stopped in 11 months later......
Jack, (bartender/manager) remembered us!  We watched California Chrome try for the Triple Crown.  The entire bar was enthralled in it.  Luckily there are MANY televisions to choose from!  We sat at the bar for a while and just chatted with everyone.  Super friendly environment, always!  Drinks are refilled quickly.  Snacks are given continuously.  I have no idea why you would go anywhere else if you are in the Union Square area!
author: Marcy B.

description:
Sam's is an unexpected treat in the heart of one of the busiest tourist areas in San Francisco...  Just outside Union Square on Powell street Sam's Cable Car Lounge is the perfect spot to take a break from the tourist packed Powell street and enjoy the company of one of the most personable and welcoming bar owners I have ever met, Sam.  If you have the pleasure of chatting with him (he makes a point of greeting every patron) be sure to ask him about the private label wine that he bottles (Sir Fox) and the collection of rare wines in the wine cellar bellow the bar.
If people watching is your thing Sam's will give you a front row seat to tourist packed streets and the restaurants namesake, the Powell street cable car
author: Antoine V.

description:
Perfect place for local bar / lounge if u r in union sq area / downtown SF
The owner is super awesome as he walks around n socialize with ppl
The bartender is also gr8 as the treat u good
Drinks r really strong , so watch out ;)
Prices r within the range 
Also the location is just perfect , am from LA n a Frnd of mine she came down to c me as am stayn @ the Hilton n she didn't drive as the BART is ri8 there , so win - win situation 
I would say , visit this place for a drink n u night like it n end up here all ni8 like us ...lol
author: Saif A.

description:
The place looked beautiful, but as soon as we walked in, we were slapped in the face by the toxic smell of paint. There were only three other people at the bar.  We had been walking around SF, all day, and just wanted to sit down for a while, rest our feet and have a drink, so we stayed.
We noticed the loud buzzing of construction tools, upstairs to the back of the building. We sat there for about 10 minutes before the waiter asked us if we wanted something.
We ordered and asked about the paint smell and the loud noise. They said it had been painted three weeks ago, and that the construction noise was "only for a few minutes"
We sat there and watched as people walked in, smelled the place and walked out.
The servers didn't check on us, and the place was dead. so we asked for the bill.
we noticed that they had added the tip to the bill, before we got it.
Nope! Not going back.
author: Adriana M.

description: Soooooooooo sweet I love Sam this was our first one in sf and he literally made it the best experience thank you so much babe!!!!!!!
author: Jillian S.

description:
This bar is a real tourist trap.

Crappy cocktails, tacky decor, overpriced, and 18% gratuity automatically added no matter what you order. 

They seem very weary of people using their restroom before ordering. I've watched one of the staff chase down a gentleman making his way toward the restroom, and that staff member didn't even remember that the gentleman had already been seated with a drink -_-
author: Anna V.

description:
i would say 3 stars for convenience, popcorn, and having the sharks game on.. 
The ambiance is casual and is cute and touristy to play up the sf theme. The staff is nice and provide popcorn and nuts. 
But the beer is way too over priced especially when the bartender couldn't pour it properly and automatically adding tip into the bill is not something I agree with. The staff didn't really chat or see if we needed anything more.. 
Just walk around the block and go anywhere else.. Wherever you end up wont be as bland.
author: Kristina B.

description:
When my friend told me about this place I was little skeptical; I mean it's in the middle of one of San Francisco's tourist areas. So I walk into the place and the wall behind the bar has a Cable Car replica  on it as if it's coming out of the wall. Hey, what do you expect? The place IS called Sam's Cable Car Lounge and the Powell Cable Car line is right outside.  So, it's appropriate for this bar in this tourist hot spot.

The clientele?
Mostly tourist, but overall friendly. I've had conversations with people from England, Ireland, Denmark, Germany, Australia, Japan, So. Cal, and even locals; and I don't necessarily consider myself to be very outgoing.

The staff?
Always friendly. Sure, there may be times where it may take a while for them to get to you, but in my experience it's rare. The bartenders are among the friendliest I've seen.

Jack is a manager here who's friendly and genuinely cares about his patrons. If you've got a problem, I'm sure he'll do what he can to try to make it right.

On occassion you'll see Sam, the owner.  He's an Interesting, friendly, older gentleman who really enjoys the music he plays here, which is for the most part good even if some selections are a bit dated.  He also chats it up with patrons.

Drinks/food?
Most of the night they're serving up complimentary snacks of popcorn, peanuts, chips and salsa, and or salami and cheese.

The few cocktails I've had have been pretty good, but I haven't been drinking a lot of cocktails for a while to give any great feedback in this area.

They have a decent imported beer selection, but it's not your run of the mill import that you'll find at many other places. And the prices for these beers are considerably higher than what a Bud drinker would expect. But if you appreciate good beer, their a safe bet, except the Beer With Me. I've had every beer here and the Beer With Me is by far the worst I've had anywhere.

Their draft beers are a slightly higher than some other bars, but it's in a tourist area, so I'm not really surprised.

Their hard liquor selection is pretty good as well. I've had a few drinks here that I haven't seen elsewhere such as Belvedere Intense, quite possibly the smoothest vodka I've had. Some of the liquors are priced about the same as other places and others are priced considerably higher. My best recommendation here is to know your liquor.

They've also got a wine cellar here, though I haven't had any of their wine.

Entertainment?
There's usually a game on at least 1 of the 3 big screen TVs they have there and there's live music Fridays and Saturdays.

Lastly, the reason why just about everyone on yelp has given this place a bad review: they automatically charge 18% gratuity no matter the order or number in your group.  In their defense, the bar is in a tourist area that draws in tourist from places where it isn't customary to tip, 2) it's in big letters on their menu that they have this policy and I'm pretty sure I've seen at least 1 sign for it as well, and 3) most of the time the bartenders will tell you that gratuity has been added when they bring you your bill so you don't accidentally double tip.  Granted, I've seen times where they haven't warned a patron, but from what I seen they warn them more often than not.
author: Dennis Z.

description: I love Sams! I went here a few days after my 21st birthday for after-work drinks and we met Sam and he was totally accommodating and kind - he made extra room for us at the bar and got me a free cable car cosmo (yum!) for my birthday! Great atmosphere, great drinks, and most importantly, awesome company!
author: Keely O.

description: Fun place to hang for a drink or three when you are in the union square area ...
author: Joe P.

description: We popped in here on a whim last weekend while we were in the city because it was the only bar we could find that was open at 3 in the afternoon. They had a sign advertising HAPPY HOUR, so we decided it was our best bet. The interior is really nice, and they offer a ton of liquor, but their prices are a little high. Their happy hour prices for a beer were $5, and as other reviewers stated, they add on a service charge to the bill. Our service was pretty great, a lot better than other reviews said, and they were really attentive and friendly. However, any establishment that automatically adds on a service charge is shady in my book.
author: Lisa M.

description: Great drinks. Warm service. Fun vibe and lively crowd. Perfect location. Free popcorn and peanuts. Come check this place out!
author: Craig H.

description:
From the moment I set foot into this place, I knew this was the place for me.  Modern, Sophisticated, Upscale, Upbeat, Comfortable,Great Music, Great Bartenders, Great Managers, Great Service, Great Location, Great Drinks, and Great Beers on Tap!   

Bottomline, Best Cocktail Lounge in the Union Square area!
author: Eric D.

description:
Went there on Friday with my husband and had the best blueberry cosmo ever! My husband had a Manhattan with good whiskey. These were both specialty drinks. The girls bartending were awesome and we got free popcorn and peanuts! We offered them drinks, but they said they weren't allowed to drink on the job :( 
I don't mind paying for good drinks and service and will be back !
author: Mex B.

description: The ice in my drink was really cold (must be a really expensive ice machine, wow) and the stool I was sitting in seemed to be very well-constructed. The pen I used to sign my receipt was notably smooth and the paper was stunningly white! This is an establishment in which patrons are able to purchase liquids AND solids. Great job, keep it up!
author: Betsey W.

description:
Jack the manager greeted us warmly.   

Funny place in union square. The most important aspect is that it's the only bar for blocks since the Gold Dust closed. Pricey but funny.   

More importantly, why not?
author: Julia C.

description: This was the worst bar I have been to in the United States, easily, it was very overpriced and includes a 22% tip in the bill, when I mentioned this to the bartender he said 'oh we just price it that way for the foreign tourists' so I would not go there whether you were local or 'foreign'.  Then I tried their 'local' wine which tasted far worse than   2 buck chuck and it was $12!!! for a glass, basically it was $36 for two beers and a glass of terrible wine, its cheaper (and better quality) at basically everywhere in the area.
author: Mark C.

description: Great pours. The owner makes you feel welcome and special. Good service. And they serve free, fresh popcorn and peanuts! Woohoo.
author: Samantha O.

description: The best bar to grab a drink after work. Located in the heart of union square surrounded by the best shopping. On top of that, Complimentary popcorn, nuts and cheese to go along with wine.
author: Daianna P.

description: Tu was the best bartender. So sweet and always made sure there was a drink in my hand when I needed one. Definitely returning here especially after a long day at work right around the corner. Thank you Tu! We loved you. And this was our first time here!
author: Maritza V.

description: Here on vacation. Was looking for bar to watch kobes last came, and they acommodated despite the fact everyone wanting to watch warriors game. Considering I'm from L.A this was perfect. Food was great and drinks were amazing. Not to mention the hostess and bartending. Totally recommend. Elizabeth provided us with table, and she provided the laker game I couldn't ask for more.
author: Gil D.

description: The staff was so incredible and nice! The drinks were delicious and unique. The best drink is their signature cable car cosmo! When you go, this is the best! My friend and i had an amazing time here! The decor, the people, the drinks....all the best a bar could offer!
author: Chelsea L.

description: Fantastic friendly customer service, knowledgeable about drinks and great recommendations.
author: Melanie D.

description: We are having a wonderful time here.  Our best place in San Francisco for drinks and snacks.  Paulson &Boldts.  Elizabeth is the best hostess ever!
author: Barbara B.

description: Great little gem of a place near Union Square. Staff was incredibly friendly and hospitable. Reserved seats at the bar right away and then complimentary, nuts and cheese AND popcorn to go with my wine (which was delish btw). Also they were playing MJ..What more could you want? Definitely coming here again when I'm in the area.
author: Angie S.

description: We found this place through Yelp!!! It was amazing service and Elizabeth and the bartenders are awesome! The drinks were super good! This is a must when in the city!
author: Tania G.

description: Came in for a beer and to check out the Dubs game for a bit, nice big TVs. Had a Lagunitas IPA, and that's it. Nice that it came with a little dish of peanuts and a mini bag of popcorn. What sucked about this place is the 18% automatic service charge. After all the additional charges (tax, etc), one $6.75 beer ended up being $9. And I tipped my bartender a buck, so my beer ended up being $10. I get that foreign tourists are not accustomed to the stupid American tipping system (seriously, how about we just eliminate it and pay servers more), but I'm sure they're smart enough to figure out what "tip" means on their check. Locals AVOID.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
While visiting San Francisco last month we were looking for a place to have a drink near our hotel. We saw Sam's Cable Car Lounge and decided to stop in for just one drink. We were greeted by the owner, Sam, and a bartender, Jack. We started with one of their specialty drinks, which was delicious.  We decided to have one more drink. After that, we were hooked. Jack and Sam were engaging and welcoming and just plain fun.  

We left for dinner, then returned later instead of going to one of the clubs we had planned to go to since we were so impressed earlier in the day. Sam and Jack welcomed us back, with Jack making our favorite drink and making sure the other bartenders knew how to make it too.   We loved those guys!!

There was a band playing and a fun crowd. We sat at the bar for hours meeting people that came in and out and many that were there as long as us. It was a fun, upbeat atmosphere. Everyone was having a great time.  The bartenders were fabulous. The drinks were perfect. The bar was clean. It was our last night in town and we were bummed we had not found Sam's earlier in our trip. 

Since returning home to our regular hangouts, we have missed Sam's even more. We will absolutely be returning next time we are in town and will be hoping Sam and Jack are there.  We highly recommend Sam's.  If you are lucky enough to meet Sam or Jack, say hello for us.  Thank you, thank you for a fun, memorable evening (and a couple of drinks). 

Tarah and Brandi
author: Tarah S.

description: Our first time in San Fran stopped by here. Very cozy atmosphere, but romantic as well. Staff is very friendly and accommodating! Good music! Great time overall
author: Keilyn C.

description: Love this place.  Great vibe! Been here 3x for the last 7 days.  Very cool bartenders and very friendly owner who gives out wine!
author: Joseph C.

description: Hands down the friendliest staff ever!! The drinks were delicious. I had the Powell St. Pear Martini, I recommend everyone try it! The owner was also really nice..go check this place out!!!
author: Dal R.

description: I can see from reading the other reviews that I had the same problem a lot of people that have come here have had . They have like 3 added charges including an auto tip added to the bill .. came in for a 4.95$ beer and ended up paying almost 7$ for it ... and that was at happy hr .. id hate to see what the price of a beer at normal hrs is here .. will def not be coming back here !!! buyers beware !!
author: Micah W.

description: Patty and boss the best service! Wow! Best experience! Patty was real good helper and fast and also momma! Great service best bar here!
author: Sumeet S.

description: Upon arrival we were seated and given water in a cup with no straw. Three elderly ladies ordered wine next to us and she gave one of them iced water with lemon zest and a straw. Obviously if you look like you have money they will treat you better. I wanted to have a few drinks there but after my Bloody Mary was infused with a very old and dry lime (tasted bitter) I decided to take me and my friends to different bar. Basically paid 15 dollars for half a glass of Bloody Mary mix and 10 dollars for stale chips with bottled salsa. Guy at the door was very kind but our waitress was very unprofessional.
author: Bri E.

description: I found myself in this place , last night to watch  NFL Monday Night Football. Greeted cordially by door man.  Seated dead center at the bar, where there were TV sets that allowed great vantage points of the game.  Wanted to stay  until half time ,  but  a couple women entering will change that. Jack M the bartender  provided me with excellent service , very punctual and  courteous .  The crowd is a mix of professionals ,  tourist  from around the globe. And the bar decor stays to the theme of cable cars , and passing of  SF own cable car along Powell. I would certainly return in the near future
author: Michael C.

description: What a great place to grab a beverage, watch the game and be treated exceptionally!  This pub was wonderful!
author: Mark O.

description: Touristy little bar located in Union Square that has a cable car theme. The staff is friendly and give you free peanuts as you sip on some drinks. They have huge TVs that play sports, ESPN and local news. I enjoyed this place and felt the pricing for beer is reasonable for its location, although cocktails seemed a little pricey for San Francisco ($14-16+). My only gripes were the 18% automatic gratuity that's added into every bill and the lack of air conditioning that made it really warm and muggy inside even at 11 pm in the evening. If staying in the area again I would return, but maybe for happy hour this time for cheaper drinks and breezier weather!
author: Brian P.

description: Stopped here for a glass of wine. Great bar, friendly bartender. Cheddar cheese and popcorn snacks.
author: Lisa T.

description:
My sister and I both had the day off and thought it would
be great to spend it shopping in the city. However,
after hitting traffic and searching for parking for what seemed like forever, once
in Macy's,  we just wanted out.  Much to my relief Sam's Cable Car was near the
exit.  We were greeted by the bartender Thomas, his service was excellent!  The best rasberry lemon drop martinis ever!  Perfectly shaken with the tiny pieces of ice just as
I like.  Sam and Charlie were also great and made us feel at home.  The music was a blast to listen to, often sparking up great conversation..  All in all, Sams Cable Car rescued us from what would've  been just a horrendous day of traffic, pedestrians, tight spaces and never ending escalators.  

Thank you!!! 

I would definitely recommend stopping in.
author: Victoriana A.

description: Do not come here. Shots are expensive.... drinks are expensive.... you can get 2 shots for the price of one just across the street. They are way over priced and not that great service. Turn around!!!!
author: Edgar C.

description: Wonderful place!  Great service, and the owner was extremely kind and generous. We had a great time at Sam's Cable Car Lounge!
author: Jamie M.

description: Was looking forward to a wonderful time with friends. We went in for drinks at Sams and were treated really horribly. Waitress told on us for apparently being too loud and the manager started harassing us. We are all in our 30s, married, and with kids. Ridiculous. Waitress didn't think we would pay for all our drinks either and had one of the staff count all of the money on our tab before they let us leave. DONT GO HERE! Try another bar.
author: Ty V.

description: just happened to stubble in here for the warriors game. and definitely surprised with the service just thinking it was just a bar where no one would care. it wasnt that busy but it got there. popcorn and peanuts on the house and we ordered the nachos. huge plain nachos with a bunch of cheese!!! wait staff very attentive even with it getting busy. happy surprise.
author: Nicole M.

description: One of my favorite places in the city to have a beer and relax. Staff is friendly, security guard too. You get popcorn, cheese and nuts with your drinks. They charge you 22% for tips, but with service you get it's worth every penny.
author: Srdjan S.

description: The beer is overpriced and the food is regular but expensive. The "served with chips" is a bag of Doritos, they give you a plastic fork for a $15  plate. They charge 18% service without asking. I just wanted to get the check and leave.
author: Sebastián C.

description: Whoa! Enjoy tourist. This local has sticker shock. Was waiting for a friend to finish up rehearsal across the street an d thought I'd check the place out. $1.50 up charge for Martini, 18% service charge for your convenience, tax and city 'healthy San Franciscian tax'. $12.95 well vodka up! We'll up yours Sam's Cable Car Lounge!
author: Karee S.

description: They sneak in a service charge on top of already overpriced drinks, randomnly ring an ear piercing bell, owner hits on female customers, very strange
author: Sam L.

description: After a long day of shopping we stopped in SAMs Cable Car and Lounge for a drink. The atmosphere was ok, plenty of patrons hanging out. The drinks are pretty pricey but I suppose that's to be expected in a busy tourist area. What will ensure that I will NEVER return was how rude the OWNER treated us. My friend had a walking cast on and was resting her foot on a chair. The owner asked her to take her foot off his chair (the chair was not cloth and could easily be wiped off plus it was just her leg resting on the chair and not the bottom of her cast). The way he spoke to us was not called for and it was not a polite request. We quickly finished our drinks and paid our tab. We will not be returning to this place!!!!
author: Risha G.

description: Terrible service. Always wanted to stop in this bar after always walking by. So disappointed. Bartender looked at my wife and I like we were something on her shoe.... And we're both professionals with $ to burn.
author: Bob M.

description: Great place. Friendly staff. Came in to watch the dubs. Awesome environment. Enjoy every trip here
author: Mark M.

description: Nice ambiance and relatively busy for a Monday night. Bad tenders were pleasant and gave us good service and well made drinks. I would recommend others to visit here. Didn't eat any food so this is purely a review on the bar and ambiance
author: Danielle D.

description: This is one of the best bars in Union Square. It is a very friendly environment and fun place to hang out at if your wanting to have a few drinks. It is one of the main tourist attractions location in San Francisco.
author: Brian G.

description: The best bar to visit, Elizabeth  is an amazing drink and cigar ambassador! Great service and great drinks!!
author: Alexa R.

description: Elizabeth found us a great seat for two during a busy time.  The bartenders pour a  great drink.  Totally recommend a stop here if you are making the rounds in Union Square.
author: Gene Y.

description: First time coming to this bar after working for so long in the city. Here, i made lots of new friends, a guy sitting next to me to some bartenders. Elizabeth, one of the employee, was so helpful when it came to drinks and cigars! Very satisfied and may be a regular with great happy hour deals!
author: Sung M.

description: Worst bar I been to in SF. Bad service. Very rude. Drinks are expensive. Not very welcoming. Automatically charges tip...
author: Li T.

description: We loved meeting the owner Sam & his friend Walter. The staff was very nice! A very friendly atmosphere!  Amazing wine!  Great location!  Thank you Sam!
author: Mary J.

description: The service was great and they had little bar snacks that they were pretty generous with.  We were just looking for a bar to roll into while on vacation and have a few drinks before going back to the hotel before dinner.  All the other reviews talk about how touristy it is well.....that is the area and there are pretty slim pickings in Union Square for during the day.  We were staying at Villa Florence across the street.  Stopped in and got great service, there were tvs for the boys playing sports.
author: Alexis D.

description: Phenomenal Bartender 'Patty' made the finest drinks eg. Old Fashion, Mojito, martinis etc. Met the owner Sam. What a guy...very generous with his wine's. Bought 3 if them. Chard and Cab. A must visit for anyone that is looking for a good time. Sports, Music, scenery I could go one. Note: talk to Jack (manager) about the wines. GET THERE!
author: Cody C.

description: Awesome service. Patty was awesome. Nice and comfortable. Good sports bar. Lots of large TV's. Popcorn and cheese snacks were a nice addition
author: Weslie P.

description: Best bar in town!! The best service's, best bartender will definitely recommend and be back!! Elizabeth, Roxanne and Daniel
author: Mercy H.

description: One of the best kept secrets of San Francisco the people are unbelievable they make you feel like you belong there a huge selection of cigars and a huge selection of wines the service is excellent ask to taste the wines spend an hour or spend the day
author: Dan B.

description: This place was awesome, came on a Friday afternoon and both the bartender (Patty) and host (Elizabeth) were nice and friendly.  Will be back again!! The lemon drop was perfectly done! Thank you Patty.
author: Slog S.

description: this place is the best Roxanne serves the best Brazilian Capirosca ever and Teresa behind the bar you wish she worked for you. Come visit them.
author: Todd S.

description: We stopped in here to wet our whistles after a long day of playing tourists. The owner(?) was super awesome and even offered our table of four fireball shots on the house! Great atmosphere, AMAZING service. Drinks were average price ($10 wine, $9 beer). Definitely recommend this place.
author: Kirie M.

description: I Love this place! The drinks are of great quality especially during happy hour.  They do include a gratuity charge but it is clearly marked.  The servers are great company.  I Love that I'm a regular and the complimentary drinks! The free popcorn and cheese are a plus! See you guys next week!
author: Sandy B.

description: My friend and I got tired of walking so decided to stop here for a quick beer and break.  The place looks trendy with a DJ spinning.  However, $20 bucks for two drafts was not worth it.  This ain't a club or a upscale entertainment facility.  I think they should rethink about their pricing strategy IMO!
author: Sid C.

description: This place is awesome. Great service and jack Is a amazing manger. Such wonderful service and they have DJs.  Owner is here and also a great vibe to be Around. Worth coming to.
author: Brandi H.

description: LOVE SAMs cable car!! Did you know they make their own wine too?! Jack the manager is amazing and so are all the bartenders. They're very hospitable and there is always a awesome crowd at SAMs. If you're looking for an awesome place with great music and awesome wine and drinks.. SAMs cable axe is your spot.
author: Michelle D.

description: San Francisco resident who frequents this bar and it is a must see when visiting the city!!!! Great service! Fantastic location! Cheers!
author: Fernando R.

description: Nicki was the best bartender! Super friendly & gave us great service!!! While my friends and I Toured the city we stumbled upon sams for some drinks, they gave us popcorn and peanuts while we had our beers for free! If I'm ever in the city I'll definitely make a stop here again! Thank you Nicki!!!!
author: Danielle F.

description: Great Sam, great coconut rum! Just go there, you will never regret!
author: Gee K.

description: I'm 99% positive they water down their hard alcohol and it's super expensive. I will never come here again. Terrible tourist trap bar.
author: Mark H.

description: 5 Stars! I came in during the week to grab a drink after walking by this place a few times. I instantly gave it two thumbs up. I liked the decor, the vibe and the staff was very welcoming! I decided to have my Birthday party here the following weekend and it turned out GREAT! Jack was able to accomidate my party and staff catered to our needs throughout the night. Everyone had a ball and I am definitely reccomending this lounge to others. The DJ was great, hospitality was present and my party had no complaints. It was worth every penny. Thank you Sam's Cable Car Lounge for everything!
author: Rosie M.

description: Came in to grab a bite and watch the end of the Warriors game, there was only a couple minutes left in the game so I wanted to finish the game off before I could examine the menu. To make a long story short, I kept getting pestered by the wait staff every two minutes about ordering until I finally was told to order something or leave immediately. I was absolutely appalled but wanted to finish watching the game so I hastily ordered a beer under pressure. I wanted to like the place but they honestly have no concept of hospitality towards clients. Won't be coming back to say the least.
author: Gustav A.

description: Awesome atmosphere with amazing staff.  Owner a complete sweetheart and the other guests are fantastic. A + prasiddha, tu, nikki and Sam are the cherry to top the joint off. Cheers.
author: Adriana V.

description: Great place! Very nice people! They give you popcorn and nuts to munch on they have cheese to pair with your wine! Very cute little spot!
author: Vanessa H.

description: Jack is your man!!! Visiting from LA and had great time super long Happy Hours....:) whenever I come back I will def. Visit.
author: Janki B.

description: Wow! Be careful when you come here,  definitely a tourist trap! Extra charges left and right!  A martini that had a wad of ice in it cost me nearly $14! Save your money and go around the corner.
author: Nichole M.

description: Good times at Sam's....The out side look brought us in and the bar tenders greeted us with friendly service. They even gave us a round on the house, thanks Jack!!
author: Larisa C.

description: Excellent atmosphere and friendly staff in the center of Union Square! A great first stop on your way to shopping, cable car, or any kind of fun.  Liquor, beer, and wine. Lots of friends to be made here!
author: Sabrina M.

description: We were walking with my friends looking for a good place where we can have a cocktail and talk a little bit and we found this place, it's really nice, good attention and the cocktails are really good, so I invite you to come  here and have a great time with good music and an excellent service!! ;)
author: Lizeth Z.

description: I usually have my after work drink at Pub City in front of Powell Bart but decided to listen to my coworker to go to a MUCH better but still convenient bar. Yes it's  touristy but the service is great and so is the happy hour! 11-7pm HH with complimentary peanuts/popcorn=SCORE! Great place to watch sports too due to all the TV's. Don't expect them to play the sound though...good background music regardless. So if you don't want to worry about getting mugged outside of Pub City after having a few drinks, Sam's will be the better choice.
author: Adlyn S.

description: Great lil bar with live DJ and good service large variety of cocktails. Has tv for the game and service was fast and friendly
author: Renee G.

description: Prasiddha was great and very etertaining...u guys hve to come here...luv it....make sure u hve ur id
author: Shizzle D.

description: ~$20 for a Manhattan?? You gotta be kidding... Was ok - nothing special - and mid-day $12 would be about right - and the place was dead
author: Charles E.

description:
walked in with my boyfriend looking to have a few shots of tequila to get the night started. first, obviously this is a GREAT location!!! 
we walked in and were greeted and served immediately. bartenders were very attentive and very friendly! 
we were introduced to a tequila neither of us had ever had before and it was by far, the best tequila I've ever had!! its called Don Julio REAL. $79/shot but damn it was worth it. we had a few shots, left and ate, came back and had a few more. 
I HIGHLY recommend this bar. everyone is very friendly, its a superb location and its also just a great vibe. we will go back next time we are in town!
author: Marci C.

description: I was in town for a couple nights. Sams was right down the street from my hotel so I stopped in. The service was wonderful! We got to meet the owner Sam,what a sweet man!! He started a conversation with us outside and offered us a round of champagne because it was my bday. I would definitely recommend this place.
author: christy l.

description: So much fun!  My friends and I attended this place last week.  The manager, Sam bought us all Fireballs and made us feel at home.  Everyone was so friendly and we had a BLAST!!  Good times.
author: Shery Y.

description: Love this place the best !!! ..Prasiddha good customer service..Linna is the best bartender can't wait to bring  all my girls back to this place.....great place to hang out and meet new friends
author: Mary S.

description:
Came here for the 1st time Sat night and to my surprised....this place not only charges taxes for your drinks but they also charge "Mandate" tax and they charge u 20% gratuity already incl on your bill!  As if the drinks and everything else in SF arent already expensive!  I already pay waaay too many taxes in Cali, i dont need anymore business' to add more taxes to my bill!  

WTF is that all about??? Don't know about you but I dont want anyone else deciding how much gratuity to give the server(s)!  I've never heard of any bars or rest in SF that charges Mandate and alcohol taxes on your bill!  I spoke w/the manager that night and he insisted that its the "new" law in SF.  I call Bullshit!  I will never set foot to this place again!  I think i may call channel 7 news about this "Mandate taxes BS" and tell them about it my experience.
author: April V.

description: The most fun bar in Union square! Bartenders are happy and there is a good vibe in the place. the Fun and happy place. Excellent dining recommend the pizza is excellent.
author: Maayan L.

description: I wish I could put zero stars for this bar. I came in here with my mom and boyfriend for the World Series. They charge 18% tip for any party and give the worst service not to mention they are racist. We got questioned for our payment twice when we clearly paid our waitress in a timely manner. My boyfriend got called out for no apparent reason and someone made a comment about how he was the only black man in the bar. We got kicked out for no reason explained to us after being in the bar for two hours and respecting their area. The most ridiculous experience I've ever had. If you are not an Arian race do not go here.
author: Shana H.

description: Sam is awesome!! We stumbled upon this place to have a quick drink and ended up staying longer than expected and we had a blast.  Prasiddha was amazing too!  Gin and tonic mixed just right and the people were so friendly.  I was visiting from out of town and wanted to get lost in SF.  This was the best place to stumble into!  ps - they give popcorn to customers.  :)
author: Helen L.

description: My husband and I were at Sam's earlier and we had a blast. We got to talk to a lot of people traveling from other countries and Sam's is just the warmest, friendliest place in the city. We live in the east bay but we will definitely come back. Roxane is the sweetest bartender you'll ever meet.  They put automatic tip, but it is all worth it and perhaps more just because they are too nice there. No regrets stumbling upon this place. Ps. The pear martini was so YUMMY!
author: Rona A.

description: Great place to grab a drink with friends on any night of the week. Friendly servers, good drinks, and fun music!
author: Alicia J.

description: Waaaaaay overpriced....hidden bullshit fees....unless you have a lot of extra cash...save your loot. $24 for 1 beer and a Vodka soda.
author: James W.

description:
What a neat little spot! I love the replica of the cable car behind the bar.. and the atmosphere is sweet and inviting. The snacks were a nice touch, the music was great, and the liquor selection and beer was just yummy! Our server was so nice, friendly and efficient. She always made sure that were enjoying ourselves and having a good time. She was also quick to get us drinks and we truly enjoyed her company! I believe her name was Fernnie? Hard to believe she is new as it seemed like she was already at home here.. sweet girl for a sweet place! Thank you nice girl! We absolutely loved everything!! 

Oh, and btw! We did not mind the gratuity being added. Our server deserved every penny and more! It amazes me when people complain about a tip being added when they should be leaving the same amount anyway! I always do and so do my server friends.. unfortunately the general public can be so cheap.. esp tourists that just don't know the custom. This is a tourist area and these servers are great! So of course the tip adding thing was fine! It's actually refreshing to see a bar or restaurant owner back their staff and make sure that they are taken care of in this way. Thanks Sam's Cable Car Lounge for the LOVELY and GREAT experience!! :)
author: Jessica C.

description: Great location. Overpriced drinks. Ordered Piroshki. Really bad. Best part of meal was free popcorn
author: Fred K.

description: I literally got kicked out for using the bathroom before ordering.
author: Brigid B.

description: The drunk bartender gives out the non-itemized receipts and charges you gratuity hoping you add more to it!! SHADY SHADY SHADY!!!!!!!!
author: Andrew W.

description: The bartender, Tu is freaking amazing! She's so sweet and helpful, she makes her drinks right away and they taste so good! Defiantly worth the money when she's around! Great service will be coming back after this!
author: Kc C.

description: From the moment we walked in and sat down the staff was so attentive and friendly. I came in with my mom, we were visiting from Austin,TX and were in Union Square. The bartender was so nice and helpful on where to eat and everywhere to see in the city loved her! The owner then came over introduced himself and greeted us and talked to us about the city and got to know us as we did him. This place is super clean staff is super on point highly recommend it!!
author: Angie K.

description: Fun owner, delicious popcorn snacks, convenient location and friendly people!  highly recommend, cheers!
author: Katelyn S.

description: Wowwww- I was totally taken off gaurd by ambience and service:-) AMAZING- I know service - bartender for 4 yrs and couldn't have been more happy to stumble upon this spot!   came here today after a lil Christmas shopping, the music is  was great and the specials were phenomenal ! Thank you SAMs Cable Car Lounge!
author: Danielle F.

description: In town for the weekend and was looking for a place to grab a quick drink to pass some time. Stopped here and was immediately impressed. The bartender was quick to get me a drink and peanuts and popcorn. The atmosphere is great and all of the staff was very friendly.  I would definitely recommend this place.
author: Patrick L.

description: Stopped by here during the afternoon after one of my training sessions in San Francisco.  Friendly folk, was hoping they'd have food when I stopped by, but I learned it was just drinks here.  Didn't really make that strong of an impression on me, so this place is just a-ok.
author: Ferdinand L.

description:
If it wasn't for the nice hostess, I would be giving it 1 star!

Overpriced and ugly décor.  They charge 18% tip on top of their overpriced drinks! And it wasn't even good!  They think this is an upscale bar in Hollywood?  

Went there with a few friends and wanted some private time, but we were interrupted with this guy, I guess he was the owner.  He kept talking about his business and asking us about our opinions and on and on.  What the ***? Why is he interrupting the customers?  Will never go back!
author: Y R.

description: Great happy hour spot right on Powell Street in the heart of Union Square. Generous pours of wine with free peanuts, popcorn, cheese and salami! You cannot beat it.
author: Bridget U.

description: Wonderful family owned business. Great place to watch a game and grabs drink. Friendly staff and wide selection of both food and beverage. Also an amazing selection of cigars if that's your poison. Highly recommend stopping by for a drink of you are in Union Square
author: Jennifer A.

description: I always have a good time at Sam's.  They have sports on the TV, lots of Marilyn Monroe pictures, and nice, pretty bartenders.  Michelle is my favorite.  I like Sam's, I really do.
author: Mike C.

description: Stopped in by chance. Had two rounds of cocktails. Then Sam came by and bought us a round of fireball shots! Great location and clean/pleasant venue. Will definitely return!
author: Brittany M.

description: You can not miss this place. The service, the drinks...everything is beyond amazing!!!!!! Theresa is the best server, the owner walks around checking on everyone. We will always come back here when in San Francisco!!!!!
author: Dawne R.

description: Totally disrespected.  I brought a group of 10 in here and they treated us like drunk idiots.  It was the first drink of the night!  The "bouncer" (50 yr old Greek dude) told us to calm down?!?
author: Sean D.

description: We were having a girl's weekend, a friend of ours was visiting from out of town, we stopped in to check it out and so glad we did. Great service!!! They welcomed us with popcorn and peanuts while we waited for our drinks. The owner Sam stopped by to say Hello and introduced himself, what a wonderful caring man. He even sat with us to get to know us!!! We had dinner reservations so we had to leave but he suggested we come back because they have a DJ and dancing in the evening. We came back after dinner and WOW. what a great time we had, the DJ was awesome and the tunes were GREAT!!! I highly recommend this place if you are visiting the city. I cannot wait to go back with my friends to dance the night away! Thanks for making our friend from out of town have a great great weekend! We had a blast!
author: Dana H.

description: Expensive tourist trap.  The ambiance of this place (zero) does not justify the high prices.  The bouncers hover in an uncomfortable way.  18% gratuity ("service charge") is automatically added to your tab.  If you want to spend $7-8 on a beer, there are much nicer places than this.  This place just has a weird vibe.
author: Brian B.

description: Very overpriced tourist trap.   It was about 85 degrees with no fans or ac.   They also charge a service fee.
author: Sterling N.

description: My friend turned 21 and they helped us celebrate and sang to him! Great way to start out the night
author: Taelor R.

description: This place is amazing, especially with co-owner, Jack. He's the sweetest man, very warm, and quick to get us a table and make us feel so welcome. The bar is fun, very convenient and has the kindest employees. Roxanne behind the bar, the amazing sweet woman bringing us food, lovely waitresses and door guards. We went 2 nights in a row and loved every minute. Jack has an amazing wine cellar and recently found out produces the club's own wine. I ordered 2 cases on the spot. This place is such a Union Square jewel.
author: Kim W.

description: Charlie and Nina are great bartenders. They have me birthday shots and popcorn!!! The place is amazing and it's so welcoming! Definitely a cute spot to stop by on your way out in the city!
author: Yvette C.

description: Sam's Cable Car Lounge is a great bar to visit in the city. We went the other night and had a wonderful time. Laura was our bar tender. She made sure we had everything we needed the entire time we where there. She was kind, caring, and attentive. The owner came by and was nice and accommodating as well. Overall we had a great time and I would definitely go back for the amazing drinks and service.
author: Ellie H.

description: This place is awesome! Super friendly staff, great drinks and prime location. My new favorite hang out!!!!
author: Chris D.

description: Such a great bar! Great staff & amazing drinks!! My fiancé and I celebrated our engagement at this bar and it was a great decision! I highly recommend this bar to engine who is looking for the ultimate bar experience.
author: Erin W.

description: I am going to steal a quote from another poster because she nailed it: "incredibly rude and pompous doorman in a cheap suit" started yelling at me like I was a stray dog when I was 5 steps in the bar demanding to see my ID-which would be Fine if he required ID from the 5 other people coming in the door. I am 47 so he was just being an ass. I know they will say they check everyone's ID and it is simply not the case. Luckily I was just picking something up or I would Not have gone inside. What a Jerk. The woman staff member I spoke to inside was very nice and helpful.
author: Susan M.

description: Sam greeted us at the door and was a true SF delight as were Jack and Charlie!  The entire staff was super friendly and sweet.  We will definitely be back and will bring our friends!  Great spot in Union Square, lots of TVs, super friendly workers, stiff drinks, what more do you need?  Highly recommend!!
author: Luke L.

description: This place is amazing!! The service couldn't get any better and the bartenders are the best! Definitely a place to check out. The people here will make you want to come back! Easy 5 stars from me!
author: Cindy N.

description: I visited this bar and people are friendly, the cocktails are very good. I recommend you to come here. Cheers!!! :)
author: Andrea D.

description: Nice long bar front with great staff. I come into the city for work from out of town and found it to be perfect  spot for end of the night wind down. Jack is one of the best bartenders in The City and would give place a 5 on the staff but limited food menu. Has 4 TVs up with sports on so great spot for football or Bball season...
author: Rico P.

description: As an out of towner from the Midwest I wanted a nice place to get a drink on the way to my hotel. Couldn't be happier about my stop here. Quick service. Great prices for the area, attentive staff. Basically what Midwesterners expect and usually can't find in the big city. Close to any hotel in the Union Square area. Can't go wrong to hang out, have a few cocktails, or sit down for a quick bite. Will be back multiple times during my stay in the city.
author: Eric H.

description:
I personally love this place. Was there yesterday with a few friends and wanted to chill and have some drinks and get a bite. Everybody who works here are very friendly and chill... But yesterday was something that I never expected our waitress was very rude and she kept pushing us to do stuff according to the way she wanted to... We felt like she was not happy to have us there. This bar would do much better if they can get rid of people like that who do this job for the tip and not for the customers... She is a tall Asian lady who has no sense of service and all she knows is to take orders and look at the bill to see how much tip you have put... Not good for the bar and not good for business...
 
I would definitely always go back to this place but would not let this money sucker waitress to take my order...
author: Mahesh K.

description: A friend and I stopped into Sam's Cable Car Lounge for the first time for happy hour one day after work. This place definitly exceeded my expectations. The service was awesome! The staff was so friendly and extremely entertaining, not to mention the complementary snacks! I was so impressed with the service I didn't think twice about the prices of the drinks, it's totaly worth it. I will definitly be going back.
author: Vanessa C.

description: So this place gets mixed reviews over price. I'm in for happy hour where beers are $4.50. I'm from south Florida and even there $4.50 for happy hour is a bit much. That being said....the place is immaculately clean and organized. No wilted, black mint in the mojitos here. The owner spent some time chatting with a local couple sitting next to me at the bar. I overheard him saying his Liqour license was a million dollars....so I get the priceyness. The added 18% tip ensures the great service. Even when I said I had enough of the free popcorn and peanuts, the bartender said please allow him to just leave it in front of me.........I ended up eating it. Pricey place but they do deliver on the presentation.
author: Ben D.

description: Sam is awesome and the place is fantastic. Great service and wonderful people! Will definitely be back!!
author: Joni V.

description: Awful place! Outrageous prices ($4 for a coke, $9 for a beer) and they add 18% gratuity for everything. Plus the owner is a total creep, staring at every woman in the place. STAY AWAY!!!!
author: Brad B.

description: Today my girlfriend and I were walking around San Francisco for the first time when we came across Sam's Cable Car Lounge. They were having a happy hour so we decided to stop in and get a quick drink. It is located directly off the cable car line (cable car drives in front of the restaurant). When we were seated at the bar we were met by a respectful and warm staff. They sat us quickly and gave us their undivided attention. After allowing us to sample some local beers, they served us with a smile on their face. It was at this point when we were approached by the owner Sam. Sam is an individual who cares about his employees and even more so about his customers. He had a genuine conversation about his life adventures and showed great interest in our journey as well. He generously provided us with his very own wine and cheese to try! It's a great place unwind and have great conversation! We will also stop in to say hi to Sam and his friendly staff when in San Fran! Highly recommend!
author: Donovan P.

description: This place is great.  Best place we went to our whole night out. I have to say the drinks are way over priced but this place has it going on. The music is great. The songs change every minute or so. The employees are really nice. You can tell that they really care about taking care of each guest. You don't even pay to get in this bar. Its nice beacuse I went to other bars and it was a charge. We will definitely be back : )
author: Brandy P.

description: We were really hungry having just arrived mid afternoon in San Francisco and happened across this place. The staff are very friendly, the Bloody Mary was very good and I had beer. Prices are what I would expect to pay for the area. The music was like a random selection of CDs from a yard sale. Michael Jackson came on a couple times at least. Probably some better choices for mid day at a sports bar. I hope the owner will take my advice on the food. It's almost like it was an after thought and random stuff was chosen to include. We had a combination pizza. It certainly wasn't fresh made and my guess is that at some point in its sorry life it was frozen. You could tell that it was a pepperoni pizza originally and additional toppings were added. It was actually just beyond warm in the middle and a little cool in spots. Definitely frozen pie. Making dough is so easy and using fresh ingredients is probably cheaper than the pie we had. Make dough in bulk and use it fresh throughout the day. Try 1/2 cup 130 degree water, 4 tablespoons olive oil, 1/4 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon sugar, 3/4 teaspoon yeast. Dissolve in the hot water and mix in 1 cup flour. Now add flour a bit at a time while kneading until it's no longer sticky. Coat with olive oil and let rise an hour or two. Roll into a thin circle about 14" across and add fresh toppings. Cook until done. So easy and so much better than frozen. I like to cook the dough after rolling it out and before topping it for about 4 minutes. Use a dough docker so it doesn't all puff up. We were going to get nachos but it was suggested that we don't. I'm guessing it was a plate of chips with melted cheese product on it. Go for the drinks if you don't mind paying big city prices but not for the food. At least not until they fix the menu and work on having the best damn bar pizza in town.
author: Greg B.

description: Great environment, great staff, great drinks, great location!! My parents and I were looking for a fun place to watch the Giant's game - and this place provided a fun environment. ALL of the staff were attentive, and really nice. They bring you peanuts and popcorn sporadically, which was a fun surprise. When I ordered a glass of wine, they bring a little dish of great cheese to pair with the wine.  The owner Sam makes it a point to walk around and talk to his customers. We ended up staying at this place for hours because we were having so much fun talking with Sam and watching the game.  Sam has a small lot wine label - Sir Fox... this is a MUST try. I left with 3 bottles that Sam signed for me. We will definitely be back!
author: Crystal N.

description:
I was referred to this place from a friend. On the first visit, I immediately became impressed by the cool signage in front, and it being ground level for my tired feet. It's right in the middle of grand central Union Square, where shopping, eating and fun times abound. The place was what I EXPECT from places I frequent: clean, trendy, stylish, touristy, intimate and classy at the same time. HAPPY HOUR IS AWESOME! Beer for $4.50! And to top it off, their hard liquor drinks are delicious and worth the slightly higher price. Their "Cable Car Cosmo" specialty drink hit the spot with a nice buzz AND great taste. The background music was a decent level and trendy. The tourists that came in were happy to spend money and relax in a prime spot of San Francisco.
