I had just missed one of the team mates of the Giants, who came in and shared a rather spendy bottle of wine with his friends. That's right, not only do they sell beer and hard drinks, but the owners wine collection is expansive and elegant. I was very impressed. 
  I see other reviews complaining about the prices, but to be honest, THIS IS UNION SQUARE, SAN FRANCISCO! 
 I also see people upset about the automatic gratuity added....I don't see a problem with it. This is standard, to tip the people who serve you. People are cheapskates when they don't tip. Call me old fashioned. I believe in supporting  the businesses that serve me and offer a classy place to hang. 18% is less than standard. And most of the foreign tourists DON'T KNOW THIS. Yet, it the tourists that mostly frequent this establishment. It's called BUSINESS. Right? 
  Another great thing I noticed (with the several visits I made to this place)
was that the owner is there a LOT, and he really cares about what his customers think. It is not unusual to see him walk up and personally check each customer to make sure they are getting what they need. I watched as the owner proceeded to get to know a couple that was seated beside me, and he bought them each a couple drinks and talked with them awhile. The guy is very people friendly. 
  The bartenders, hosts and door man are all very friendly and it is obvious they love their job. They do it well. 
  This place caters to the tourists very well, but is also a hot spot for the locals to come in and enjoy happy hour and relaxation in a classy environment. This is no hole-in -the-wall dive. You get what you pay for people. You want class? Get out there and get it. You'll find it here. Not kidding. 
  In talking with the owner on one of my visits, I found out he is also gearing up for live music in his place every weekend. This will be a big bonus, as it will go into the wee hour of morning for all of us late night flowers. :)
A perfect spot for parties to hang out after an event.    I say YES!  Wayyyyyyyy!!!!!
woop woop!
author: Kimberly S.

description: I am a native,  and I will be the first to tell anyone who reads this.  DO NOT COME TO THIS BAR. EVER.   Please trust me on this.  There are so many better places  to go.  The drinks are way way WAY over priced plus they tag on an 18% "service charge"  Hey, I get it,  servers have got to get tipped too.  But let me decided the tip please.  When we paid with a debit card there was a section on the receipt that said "tip" So if you're from out of town and aren't too familiar with our tipping customs you might just pay even more money for mediocre (at best)  food and drinks.  We had 4 cocktails for a grand total of $77.  That is not normal at all.  In fact it's downright offensive.  My wife and I are actually ashamed that we came into this place.  The only reason I'm writing this review is in the hopes that someone won't be foolish enough to go here.  I consider this place a shameful blight on our fair city.
author: Warden L.

description: I've never felt so welcome in a bar of any kind.  Jack, owner was gracious, friendly to all of us...couldn't do enough for us.  Loved the ambiance and the other customers, who were a mix of business, travelers and others who were fun.  The staff is unbelievable...sample appetizers, welcoming conversation just as if we were in their homes.  Very kind people and appreciate your business.  Love, love, love them all.
author: David M.

description: Friendly staff, excellent service, and nice ambiance!  Price is higher than normal but, then again, you're in the busiest tourist spot of downtown San Francisco.
author: Dennis M.

description: Wow the first off great staff ! Love Salem , Jack and Winnie . First time here a few months ago they really took good care of me .  Jack and Salem they are really wonderful and great . I never went to an bar where they really took care of you . They chat with you and make you feel like friends and family . Winnie is also amazing I met her here and she's wonderful and a very sweet girl . She's an amazing bartender . I would continue coming here as long as Salem , jack and Winnie is here . This place make me feel like home . The service from jack , Salem and Winnie is great . I feel like I'm home whenever I'm here . My favorite peps will always take care of me when I'm here my fav bar to hang out in with my fav peps working . This review is long over due been so busy haven't had a chance to give an shout out to  jack , Salem and Winnie . Will always be here when you guys are working . Great to have an chance to meet you all and always fun to hang out with . Thanks guys for making this place my spot !!!!!!
author: eliza l.

description:
Great location, bar, staff, snacks and atmostphere.  Tired from shopping, thought a quick drink was needed. Happy hour Friday was in progress.  Jack / Sam and Redhead girl served us.  We got offered an extra couple of glasses of wine FREE if we purchased a bottle of the owners house bottled wine (the Cab is fantastic!).  18% graduity was added.  $95 total bill in 30 minutes, not bad for food (nuts, nacho and salsa AND cheese) 5 glasses of wine (large pours) and 2 yummy bottles of Cab to go. Thats good business not a tourist trap.
Thank you!
author: Jane T.

description: Got cut off after 5 drinks.  Really??? Not cool.  We were the only people here and they kicked us out.  What a shame!!!!
author: Juan A.

description: This place sucks. No volume on the tvs during the niner game? That alone should get the words "sports bar" taken off your door. Get your ish together if you're going to charge $7 for a beer, and include an 18% gratuity.
author: R. E.

description: My Boyfriend and his cousin stumbled into Sam's Cable Lounge on a Sunday night because they wanted to watch the Niners game as I shopped around with my friend in Union Square. We got tired of shopping and wanted a beer so we decided to meet them there. As we approached the front door security wouldn't let us in because it was crazy busy inside. The owner Sam was nice enough to let us in because my BF was already inside.   We enjoyed the rest of the game and after 2 beers we met some people out of town. Everyone was so nice in there. From the really nice Bartenders to the Sam the owner of the bar. I had so much fun in this bar. We only wanted to grab a quick beer and head back to Sacramento. Later 2 beers ended up being another 3 rounds of Grey Goose. We even enjoyed a yummy Irish car bomb! We ended staying a couple hours there. I highly recommend those that are visiting SF to come by this Bar and enjoy a drink. They gave us popcorn and peanuts to enjoy! An added bonus! =) The owner Sam really is a nice person. He walks around and socializes with his customers. Thanks for a great time!
author: Lien V.

description: This place is awesome!! Such a great feel to it with very friendly service! They also have their own wine which is delicious!
author: Connie N.

description: Over all okay my biggest complaint is the bouncer.  I had a splitting headache worked all day.  When I left he told me I needed to smile.   I dont think that is the job of a bouncer to tell people they need to smile.  Also beware they add 18% tip to the bill.  They will take it off but...Prices are reasonable and bar service friendly......
author: Mary V.

description: Excellent service! Friendly staff! And a real great time! Me and sister went and had a blast! Defiantly coming again soon!
author: Mallan G.

description: The service was fine but I don't understand why a $14 drink ends up being $18.60. I don't care if the owner adds 18% because of the "European tourists." I have never been to a bar in this city that does that. Ever. And I drink a lot.
author: Brandy L.

description: Granted that i did come here on black friday, it was ridiculously over priced, the chips and salsa (4.95) and your average cocktail was between $11 to $15, a fun atmosphere, the manager was the most helpful of the staff
author: Michael F.

description: Do not go here!  The place has lousy, no taste decor, and overpriced drinks.  A beer on tap is around 10.30 and a bud light is around $9!  The only nice thing about this place are the nice female bartenders, who I feel sorry for, because they have such a jackass for a boss.  The owner is a greedy jackass and treats customers poorly, i can only imagine how he treats his staff.  Do not go here or support him.
author: Julie G.

description: This place is certainly goofy and touristy, but in a good way. I like their popcorn. Good for a chill daytime drink.
author: John M.

description: Overpriced, plus mandatory tip around 18%. It's here to screw tourists that may never be back anyway.
author: William R.

description: Are you kidding me?  7.75 for a jack and diet, 18% gratuity added. 18% service charge added.  $.35 mystery charge added.  Total 10.30.
author: cody k.

description: This is a new bar. 2 months since it opened. Very friendly very relaxing.  Staff is amazing. With a new lounge you should always expect some delay. But this is my go to place from now on going forward.
author: Matt V.

description: This place is awesome! Good atmosphere and service and the servers and bartenders are kind.
author: Nichole V.

description: Fernie aka Fergie is our favorite!! She makes the best shots and even dances for us.  This bar is our favorite!!  My wife & I frequent this bar on our weekly date nights.
author: Michael W.

description: This is the chillest but most CRACKIN spot in the city. Super cool and great services. Plus I just got free shots by SALIM for writing this heeeeey !!! ;)
author: Hannah G.

description: Great drinks love Powell St. pear martini!! Charlie was an awesome bartenders!! Free popcorn and nuts.
author: Kristy L.

description: The atmosphere and workers here are very friendly and generous. The owner gave us free drinks and was crackin jokes with us. Great place to watch sports because they have lots of tv's.
author: David N.

description: I'm a native San Franciscan and rarely go out downtown. My girlfriends and I were shopping at Union Square when we decided to grab a drink. We walked into Sam's Cable Car Lounge.  The bar was very clean and the staff was upbeat and welcoming. The bartenders helped us decide on a fun cocktail.  We had a great time chatting with out of towners/visitors and giving them ideas on where to go in SF. Overall, this bar is a great place, with great people, and yummy drinks. I'd definitely go back again.
author: Meghan D.

description: A small group of girls came to San Fran to celebrate some birthdays and while we were shopping in Union Square we decided to stop at Sam's Cable car lounge to have a cocktail and take a break.  Im so glad we did!  I had a great Bloody Mary and the prices actually weren't bad.  $7 for a great bloody mary and we met the owner Sam.  Such a nice and funny guy!  We enjoyed sitting with him and talking.  He was very generous to us and we even ended up going back that night for the Beatles Tribute Band that was playing there.  I highly recommend going to Sam's Cable Car Lounge!  Look for the Andy Worhol Marilyn Monrow painting!
author: Melissa N.

description: Awesome place! I work 2 blocks away and always come here. The people are so nice and its a great atmoshpere. Tvs everywhere so u can watch a game anywhere..
author: Bryan H.

description: Loved the vibe. Prasiddha was so sweet and welcoming it made the experience so much more fun. The drinks were great!!
author: Melissa Q.

description: great atmosphere for casual drinks. the staff is very friendly, and you get free cheese with your wine :D
author: Ryann P.

description: Awesome place!!  Great happy hour, great bartenders, and friendly people!!  Great stop before, during, or after shopping at Union Square...catch the game too!  Complimentary popcorn and peanuts...but do note they automatically add gratuity to the check....if you've had a few too many (geez don't we all walk in San Francisco?) then you don't have to worry about doing any math!
author: Jennifer N.

description: Great bar!  Cool music and drinks.  Bartender is hilarious and heavy handed.  Love that.
author: Chris G.

description: New location, Great atmosphere, friendly service...Charlie the manager took care of us. Visit this location for a drink and more.
author: Sean M.

description: Sam, thanks to you...had a funtastic & wild time dancing for the crowd last night! The cocktails were tasty, not too strong which is good if you plan on dancing for the rest of the night! The rest of the staff was very friendly too! I would recommend you guys to any friends who are thirsty and looking for somewhere to practice their dance moves! ;D
author: Mz. Social B.

description: My wife and I came to San Francisco for our get away/ honey moon and the owner sp happened to be there and bought us 2 cups of expensive Champagne... at first it was good service.  But then it got better with the owner doing what he did and the manager was awesome and very friendly.  And as others say , it was not expensive.  It really isnt. Its a fair price.  San Francisco tax is higher than what we used to so I would recommend this place to  tourist thumbs up. .
author: JJ F.

description: Great service yummy cocktails! Yes, 18% gratuity is added but at least you don't have to think about the tip. Nice break from the square
author: Katie S.

description: Walking up Powell, happened to noticed a Piano in the window. Decided to walk in. Turns out this Lounge just opened less then a month ago. Was originally a Wine Store. Great Decor with a Cable Car coming out of the Wall overlooking the Bar. An impression the the Golden Gate Bridge on another wall. A miniature replica of major scenic attractions of San Francisco. T.V.'s strategically placed for the Sports Aficionado. The bar staff was Wonderful. They were courteous and very friendly.  Well versed in Spirits of your delight. Was lucky enough to meet Sam him self. He came right up to us and introduced himself. He treated us like family. He told us he just opened the lounge less then a month ago. He prides himself in making the customer happy. He designed the lounge for all. Having a live Pianist, Up Beat recorded music, a VIP Section over looking the bar Area with DJ for the more discreet (To be open within week or so of this writing), and finishing up a private lounge on the second floor that will be available for private parties. Did I say wine. Yes, large selection of wine to order. Lower end and for those who can afford. I definitely plan on going back.
author: J G.

description: Sam was awesome! So were Jack and Charlie! Had a great time celebrating my daughters birthday!
author: Kris B.
